\u003ccode\u003eRimeNonJsonTTSService\u003c/code\u003e which supports non-JSON streaming mode. This\nnew class supports websocket streaming for the Arcana model.\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3085\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3085/hovercard\"\u003e#3085\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded additional functionality related to \"thinking\", for Google and\nAnthropic LLMs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew typed parameters for Google and Anthropic LLMs that control the\nmodels' thinking behavior (like how much thinking to do, and whether to\noutput thoughts or thought summaries):\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eAnthropicLLMService.ThinkingConfig\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGoogleLLMService.ThinkingConfig\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew frames for representing thoughts output by LLMs:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLLMThoughtStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLLMThoughtTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLLMThoughtEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eA generic mechanism for recording LLM thoughts to context, used\nspecifically to support Anthropic, whose thought signatures are expected\nto appear alongside the text of the thoughts within assistant context\nmessages. See:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLLMThoughtEndFrame.signature\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLLMAssistantAggregator\u003c/code\u003e handling of the above field\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eAnthropicLLMAdapter\u003c/code\u003e handling of \u003ccode\u003e\"thought\"\u003c/code\u003e context messages\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGoogle-specific logic for inserting thought signatures into the context,\nto help maintain thinking continuity in a chain of LLM calls. See:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGoogleLLMService\u003c/code\u003e sending \u003ccode\u003eLLMMessagesAppendFrame\u003c/code\u003es to add\nLLM-specific\n\u003ccode\u003e\"thought_signature\"\u003c/code\u003e messages to context\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGeminiLLMAdapter\u003c/code\u003e handling of \u003ccode\u003e\"thought_signature\"\u003c/code\u003e messages\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAn expansion of \u003ccode\u003eTranscriptProcessor\u003c/code\u003e to process LLM thoughts in\naddition to user and assistant utterances. See:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTranscriptProcessor(process_thoughts=True)\u003c/code\u003e (defaults to \u003ccode\u003eFalse\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eThoughtTranscriptionMessage\u003c/code\u003e, which is now also emitted with the\n\u003ccode\u003e\"on_transcript_update\"\u003c/code\u003e event\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3175\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3175/hovercard\"\u003e#3175\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eData and control frames can now be marked as non-interruptible by using the\n\u003ccode\u003eUninterruptibleFrame\u003c/code\u003e mixin. Frames marked as \u003ccode\u003eUninterruptibleFrame\u003c/code\u003e will\nnot be interrupted during processing, and any queued frames of this type will\nbe retained in the internal queues. This is useful when you need ordered\nframes (data or control) that should not be discarded or cancelled due to\ninterruptions.\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3189\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3189/hovercard\"\u003e#3189\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eon_conversation_detected\u003c/code\u003e event to \u003ccode\u003eVoicemaiDetector\u003c/code\u003e.\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3207\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3207/hovercard\"\u003e#3207\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003ex-goog-api-client\u003c/code\u003e header with Pipecat's version to all Google\nservices' requests.\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3208\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3208/hovercard\"\u003e#3208\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for the HeyGen LiveAvatar API (see \u003ca href=\"https://www.liveavatar.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.liveavatar.com/\u003c/a\u003e).\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3210\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3210/hovercard\"\u003e#3210\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded to \u003ccode\u003eAWSNovaSonicLLMService\u003c/code\u003e functionality related to the new (and now\ndefault) Nova 2 Sonic model (\u003ccode\u003e\"amazon.nova-2-sonic-v1:0\"\u003c/code\u003e):\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded the \u003ccode\u003eendpointing_sensitivity\u003c/code\u003e parameter to control how quickly the\nmodel decides the user has stopped speaking.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMade the assistant-response-trigger hack a no-op. It's only needed for\nthe older Nova Sonic model.\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3212\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3212/hovercard\"\u003e#3212\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://docs.ultravox.ai\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eUltravox Realtime\u003c/a\u003e is now a supported\nspeech-to-speech service.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eUltravoxRealtimeLLMService\u003c/code\u003e for the integration.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003e49-ultravox-realtime.py\u003c/code\u003e example (with tool calling).\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3227\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3227/hovercard\"\u003e#3227\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded Daily PSTN dial-in support to the development runner with \u003ccode\u003e--dialin\u003c/code\u003e\nflag. dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a bug in \u003ccode\u003eAWSNovaSonicLLMService\u003c/code\u003e where we would mishandle cancelled\ntool calls in the context, resulting in errors.\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3212\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3212/hovercard\"\u003e#3212\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBetter support conversation history with Gemini 2.5 Flash Image (model\n\"gemini-2.5-flash-image\"). Prior to this fix, the model had no memory of\nprevious images it had generated, so it wouldn't be able to iterate on\nthem.\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3224\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3224/hovercard\"\u003e#3224\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSupport conversations with Gemini 3 Pro Image (model\n\"gemini-3-pro-image-preview\"). Prior to this fix, after the model generated\nan image the conversation would not be able to progress.\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3224\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3224/hovercard\"\u003e#3224\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e was not updating\nvoice settings when receiving a \u003ccode\u003eTTSUpdateSettingsFrame\u003c/code\u003e.\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3226\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3226/hovercard\"\u003e#3226\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed the return type for \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCRequestHandler.handle_web_request()\u003c/code\u003e\nfunction.\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3230\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3230/hovercard\"\u003e#3230\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFix a bug in LLM context audio content handling\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3234\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3234/hovercard\"\u003e#3234\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIn \u003ccode\u003eGladiaSTTService\u003c/code\u003e, reset the \u003ccode\u003e_bytes_sent\u003c/code\u003e counter on connecting the\nwebsocket. This avoids unnecessary audio buffer trimming.\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3236\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3236/hovercard\"\u003e#3236\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a TTS service word-timestamp issue that could cause generated\n\u003ccode\u003eTTSTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e instances to have an incorrect pts (\u003ccode\u003epts = -1\u003c/code\u003e).\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3240\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3240/hovercard\"\u003e#3240\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eSimpleTextAggreagtor\u003c/code\u003e where spaces were not being stripped\nbefore returning the aggregation. This resulted in an extra space for TTS\nservices that don't support word-timestamp alignment data.\n(PR \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3247\" data-hovercard-type=\"pull_request\" data-hovercard-url=\"/pipecat-ai/pipecat/pull/3247/hovercard\"\u003e#3247\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv \u003ccode\u003ept\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003enl\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ear\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eru\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ero\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ezh\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdated the default model to \u003ccode\u003easyncflow_multilingual_v1.0\u003c/code\u003e for improved\naccuracy and broader language logging to include Deepgram request IDs for improved\ndebugging.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eText Aggregation Improvements:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBreaking Change\u003c/strong\u003e: \u003ccode\u003eBaseTextAggregator.aggregate()\u003c/code\u003e now returns\n\u003ccode\u003eAsyncIterator[Aggregation]\u003c/code\u003e instead of \u003ccode\u003eOptional[Aggregation]\u003c/code\u003e. This\nenables the aggregator to return multiple results based on the provided\ntext.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRefactored text aggregators to use inheritance: \u003ccode\u003eSkipTagsAggregator\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003ePatternPairAggregator\u003c/code\u003e now inherit from \u003ccode\u003eSimpleTextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e, reusing\nthe base class's sentence detection logic.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eImproved interruption handling to prevent bots from repeating themselves. LLM\nservices that return multiple sentences in a single response (e.g.,\n\u003ccode\u003eGoogleLLMService\u003c/code\u003e) are now split into individual sentences before being sent\nto TTS. This ensures interruptions occur at sentence boundaries, preventing\nthe bot from repeating content after being interrupted during long responses.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eAICFilter\u003c/code\u003e to use Quail STT as the default model\n(\u003ccode\u003eAICModelType.QUAIL_STT\u003c/code\u003e). Quail STT is optimized for human-to-machine\ninteraction (e.g., voice agents, speech-to-text) and operates at a native\nsample rate of 16 kHz with fixed enhancement parameters.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf an unexpected exception is caught, or if \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.push_error()\u003c/code\u003e is\ncalled with an exception, the file name and line number where the exception\noccured are now logged.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated Smart Turn model weights to v3.1.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSmart Turn analyzer now uses the full context of the turn rather than just\nthe audio since VAD last triggered.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eCartesiaSTTService\u003c/code\u003e to return the full transcription \u003ccode\u003eresult\u003c/code\u003e in the\n\u003ccode\u003eTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eInterimTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e. This provides access to\nword timestamp data.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eHumeTTSService\u003c/code\u003e changes:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded tracking headers (\u003ccode\u003eX-Hume-Client-Name\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eX-Hume-Client-Version\u003c/code\u003e)\nto all requests made by \u003ccode\u003eHumeTTSService\u003c/code\u003e to the Hume API for better usage\ntracking and analytics.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003estop()\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ecancel()\u003c/code\u003e cleanup methods to \u003ccode\u003eHumeTTSService\u003c/code\u003e to\nproperly close the HTTP client and prevent resource leaks.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" Now, audio is flushed when the TTS services receives the\n\u003ccode\u003eLLMFullResponseEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eDeepgramTTSService\u003c/code\u003e where a \u003ccode\u003eTTSStoppedFrame\u003c/code\u003e was\nincorrectly pushed after a functional call. This caused an issue with the\nvoice-ui-kit's conversational panel rending of the LLM output after a\nfunction call.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where \u003ccode\u003eLLMTextFrame.skip_tts\u003c/code\u003e was being overwritten by LLM\nservices.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue that caused \u003ccode\u003eWebsocketService\u003c/code\u003e instances to attempt\nreconnection during shutdown.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e where character usage metrics were\nonly reported on the first TTS generation per turn.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv \u003ccode\u003elogger.exception\u003c/code\u003e calls with\n\u003ccode\u003elogger.error\u003c/code\u003e throughout the codebase.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003ecache_read_input_tokens\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ecache_creation_input_tokens\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003ereasoning_tokens\u003c/code\u003e to OTel spans for LLM call\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eLiveKitRESTHelper\u003c/code\u003e utility class for managing LiveKit rooms via REST API.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDeepgramSageMakerSTTService\u003c/code\u003e which connects to a SageMaker hosted\nDeepgram STT model. Added \u003ccode\u003e07c-interruptible-deepgram-sagemaker.py\u003c/code\u003e\nfoundational example.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eSageMakerBidiClient\u003c/code\u003e to connect to SageMaker hosted BiDi compatible\nservices.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for \u003ccode\u003einclude_timestamps\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eenable_logging\u003c/code\u003e in\n\u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsRealtimeSTTService\u003c/code\u003e. When \u003ccode\u003einclude_timestamps\u003c/code\u003e is enabled,\ntimestamp data is included in the \u003ccode\u003eTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e's \u003ccode\u003eresult\u003c/code\u003e\nparameter.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded optional speaking rate control to \u003ccode\u003eInworldTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduced a new \u003ccode\u003eAggregatedTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e type to support passing text along with\nan \u003ccode\u003eaggregated_by\u003c/code\u003e field to describe the type of text\nincluded. \u003ccode\u003eTTSTextFrame\u003c/code\u003es now inherit from \u003ccode\u003eAggregatedTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e. With this\ninheritance, an observer can watch for \u003ccode\u003eAggregatedTextFrame\u003c/code\u003es to accumlate the\nperceived output and determine whether or not the text was spoken based on if\nthat frame is also a \u003ccode\u003eTTSTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWith this frame, the llm token stream can be transformed into custom\ncomposable chunks, allowing for aggregation outside the TTS service. This\nmakes it possible to listen for or handle those aggregations and sets the\nstage for doing things like composing a best effort of the perceived llm\noutput in a more digestable form and to do so whether or not it is processed\nby a TTS or if even a TTS exists.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduced \u003ccode\u003eLLMTextProcessor\u003c/code\u003e: A new processor meant to allow customization\nfor how LLMTextFrames should be aggregated and considered. It's purpose is to\nturn \u003ccode\u003eLLMTextFrame\u003c/code\u003es into \u003ccode\u003eAggregatedTextFrame\u003c/code\u003es. By default, a TTSService\nwill still aggregate \u003ccode\u003eLLMTextFrame\u003c/code\u003es by sentence for the service to\nconsume. However, if you wish to override how the llm text is aggregated, you\nshould no longer override the TTS's internal text_aggregator, but instead,\ninsert this processor between your LLM and TTS in the pipeline.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNew \u003ccode\u003ebot-output\u003c/code\u003e RTVI message to represent what the bot actually \"says\".\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eRTVIObserver\u003c/code\u003e now emits \u003ccode\u003ebot-output\u003c/code\u003e messages based off the new\n\u003ccode\u003eAggregatedTextFrame\u003c/code\u003es (\u003ccode\u003ebot-tts-text\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ebot-llm-text\u003c/code\u003e are still\nsupported and generated, but \u003ccode\u003ebot-transcript\u003c/code\u003e is now deprecated in lieu of\nthis new, more thorough, message).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe new \u003ccode\u003eRTVIBotOutputMessage\u003c/code\u003e includes the fields:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003espoken\u003c/code\u003e: A boolean indicating whether the text was spoken by TTS\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eaggregated_by\u003c/code\u003e: A string representing how the text was aggregated\n(\"sentence\", \"word\", \"my custom aggregation\")\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduced new fields to \u003ccode\u003eRTVIObserver\u003c/code\u003e to support the new \u003ccode\u003ebot-output\u003c/code\u003e\nmessaging:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003ebot_output_enabled\u003c/code\u003e: Defaults to True. Set to false to disable bot-output\nmessages.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eskip_aggregator_types\u003c/code\u003e: Defaults to \u003ccode\u003eNone\u003c/code\u003e. Set to a list of strings that\nmatch aggregation types that should not be included in bot-output\nmessages. (Ex. \u003ccode\u003ecredit_card\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduced new methods, \u003ccode\u003eadd_text_transformer()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eremove_text_transformer()\u003c/code\u003e, to \u003ccode\u003eRTVIObserver\u003c/code\u003e to support providing (and\nsubsequently removing) callbacks for various types of aggregations (or all\naggregations with \u003ccode\u003e*\u003c/code\u003e) that can modify the text before being sent as a\n\u003ccode\u003ebot-output\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003etts-text\u003c/code\u003e message. (Think obscuring the credit card or\ninserting extra detail the client might want that the context doesn't need.)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIn \u003ccode\u003eMiniMaxHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for speech-2.6-hd and speech-2.6-turbo models\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded languages: Afrikaans, Bulgarian, Catalan, Danish, Persian, Filipino,\nHebrew, Croatian, Hungarian, Malay, Norwegian, Nynorsk, Slovak, Slovenian,\nSwedish, and Tamil\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new emotions: calm and fluent\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eenable_logging\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eSimliVideoService\u003c/code\u003e input parameters. It's disabled\nby default.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eChanged\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-changed-2\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Changed\" href=\"#changed-2\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eFishAudioTTSService\u003c/code\u003e default model to \u003ccode\u003es1\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eDeepgramTTSService\u003c/code\u003e to use Deepgram's TTS websocket API. \u003cg-emoji class=\"g-emoji\" alias=\"warning\"\u003e⚠️\u003c/g-emoji\u003e This is\na potential breaking change, which only affects you if you're self-hosting\n\u003ccode\u003eDeepgramTTSService\u003c/code\u003e. Currently, that just means a \u003ccode\u003etype\u003c/code\u003e, so\nthat the aggregation can be classified or described. Changes made to support\nthis:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cg-emoji class=\"g-emoji\" alias=\"warning\"\u003e⚠️\u003c/g-emoji\u003e IMPORTANT: Aggregators are now expected to strip leading/trailing white\nspace characters before returning their aggregation from \u003ccode\u003eaggregation()\u003c/code\u003e or\n\u003ccode\u003e.text\u003c/code\u003e. This way all aggregators have a consistent contract allowing\ndownstream use to know how to stitch aggregations back together.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp myAggregator.aggregate(text)\nprint(f\u0026quot;successfully aggregated text: {aggregation}\u0026quot;)\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eaggregation\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003emyAggregator\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eaggregate\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003etext\u003c/span\u003e)\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eprint\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003ef\"successfully aggregated text: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eaggregation\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e)\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNow:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"aggregation = myAggregator.aggregate(text)\nif aggregation:\n  print(f\u0026quot;successfully aggregated text: {aggregation.text}\u0026quot;)\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eaggregation\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003emyAggregator\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eaggregate\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003etext\u003c/span\u003e)\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003eif\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eaggregation\u003c/span\u003e:\n  \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eprint\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003ef\"successfully aggregated text: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eaggregation\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etext\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e)\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eSimpleTextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eSkipTagsAggregator\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ePatternPairAggregator\u003c/code\u003e\nupdated to produce/consume \u003ccode\u003eAggregation\u003c/code\u003e objects.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAll uses of the above Aggregators have been updated accordingly.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAugmented the \u003ccode\u003ePatternPairAggregator\u003c/code\u003e so that matched patterns can be treated\nas their own aggregation, taking advantage of the new. To that end:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduced a new, preferred version of \u003ccode\u003eadd_pattern\u003c/code\u003e to support a new option\nfor treating a match as a separate aggregation returned from\n\u003ccode\u003eaggregate()\u003c/code\u003e. This replaces the now deprecated \u003ccode\u003eadd_pattern_pair\u003c/code\u003e method\nand you provide a \u003ccode\u003eMatchAction\u003c/code\u003e in lieu of the \u003ccode\u003eremove_match\u003c/code\u003e field.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eMatchAction\u003c/code\u003e enum: \u003ccode\u003eREMOVE\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eKEEP\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eAGGREGATE\u003c/code\u003e, allowing customization\nfor how a match should be handled.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eREMOVE\u003c/code\u003e: The text along with its delimiters will be removed from the\nstreaming text. Sentence aggregation will continue on as if this text\ndid not exist.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eKEEP\u003c/code\u003e: The delimiters will be removed, but the content between them\nwill be kept. Sentence aggregation will continue on with the internal\ntext included.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eAGGREGATE\u003c/code\u003e: The delimiters will be removed and the content between will\nbe treated as a separate aggregation. Any text before the start of the\npattern will be returned early, whether or not a complete sentence was\nfound. Then the pattern will be returned. Then the aggregation will\ncontinue on sentence matching after the closing delimiter is found. The\ncontent between the delimiters is not aggregated by sentence. It is\naggregated as one single block of text.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003ePatternMatch\u003c/code\u003e now extends \u003ccode\u003eAggregation\u003c/code\u003e and provides richer info to\nhandlers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cg-emoji class=\"g-emoji\" alias=\"warning\"\u003e⚠️\u003c/g-emoji\u003e Breaking change: The \u003ccode\u003ePatternMatch\u003c/code\u003e type returned to handlers registered\nvia \u003ccode\u003eon_pattern_match\u003c/code\u003e has been updated to subclass from the new\n\u003ccode\u003eAggregation\u003c/code\u003e type, which means that \u003ccode\u003econtent\u003c/code\u003e has been replaced with\n\u003ccode\u003etext\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003epattern_id\u003c/code\u003e has been replaced with \u003ccode\u003etype\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"async dev on_match_tag(match: PatternMatch):\n   pattern = match.type # instead of match.pattern_id\n   text = match.text # instead of match.content\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003easync\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003edev\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eon_match_tag\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003ematch\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-v\"\u003ePatternMatch\u003c/span\u003e):\n   \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003epattern\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003ematch\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etype\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# instead of match.pattern_id\u003c/span\u003e\n   \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003etext\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003ematch\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etext\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# instead of match.content\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e now includes the field \u003ccode\u003eappend_to_context\u003c/code\u003e to support setting\nwhether or not the encompassing text should be added to the LLM context (by\nthe LLM assistant aggregator). It defaults to \u003ccode\u003eTrue\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTTSService\u003c/code\u003e base class updates:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTTSService\u003c/code\u003es now accept a new \u003ccode\u003eskip_aggregator_types\u003c/code\u003e to avoid speaking\ncertain aggregation types (now determined/returned by the aggregator)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduced the ability to do a just-in-time transform of text before it gets\nsent to the TTS service via callbacks you can set up via a new init field,\n\u003ccode\u003etext_transforms\u003c/code\u003e or a new method \u003ccode\u003eadd_text_transformer()\u003c/code\u003e. This makes it\npossible to do things like introduce TTS-specific tags for spelling or\nemotion or change the pronunciation of something on the\nfly. \u003ccode\u003eremove_text_transformer\u003c/code\u003e has also been added to support removing a\nregistered transform callback.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTTS services push \u003ccode\u003eAggregatedTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e in addition to \u003ccode\u003eTTSTextFrame\u003c/code\u003es when\neither an aggregation occurs that should not be spoken or when the TTS\nservice supports word-by-word timestamping. In the latter case, the\n\u003ccode\u003eTTSService\u003c/code\u003e preliminarily generates an \u003ccode\u003eAggregatedTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e, aggregated by\nsentence to generate the full sentence content as early as possible.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eCartesiaTTSService\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eModified use of custom default text_aggregator to avoid deprecation warnings\nand push users towards use of transformers or the \u003ccode\u003eLLMTextProcessor\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded convenience methods for taking advantage of Cartesia's SSML tags:\nspell, emotion, pauses, volume, and speed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eRimeTTSService\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eModified use of custom default text_aggregator to avoid deprecation warnings\nand push users towards use of transformers or the \u003ccode\u003eLLMTextProcessor\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded convenience methods for taking advantage of Rime's customization\noptions: spell, pauses, pronunciations, and inline speed control.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe TTS constructor field, \u003ccode\u003etext_aggregator\u003c/code\u003e is deprecated in favor of the new\n\u003ccode\u003eLLMTextProcessor\u003c/code\u003e. TTSServices still have an internal aggregator for support\nof default behavior, but if you want to override the aggregation behavior, you\nshould use the new processor.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe RTVI \u003ccode\u003ebot-transcription\u003c/code\u003e event is deprecated in favor of the new\n\u003ccode\u003ebot-output\u003c/code\u003e message which is the canonical representation of bot output\n(spoken or not). The code still emits a transcription message for backwards\ncompatibility while transition occurs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eDeprecated \u003ccode\u003eadd_pattern_pair\u003c/code\u003e in the \u003ccode\u003ePatternPairAggregator\u003c/code\u003e which takes a\n\u003ccode\u003epattern_id\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eremove_match\u003c/code\u003e field in favor of the new \u003ccode\u003eadd_pattern\u003c/code\u003e method\nwhich takes a \u003ccode\u003etype\u003c/code\u003e and an \u003ccode\u003eaction\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eenglish_normalization\u003c/code\u003e input parameter for \u003ccode\u003eMiniMaxHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e is\ndeprecated, use \u003ccode\u003etest_normalization\u003c/code\u003e instead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv prevent dangling tasks in case the\nuser was speaking and we stop receiving audio.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduced a minimum confidence parameter in \u003ccode\u003eDeepgramFluxSTTService\u003c/code\u003e to avoid\ngenerating transcriptions below a defined threshold.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp alias=\"warning\"\u003e⚠️\u003c/g-emoji\u003e Breaking change: \u003ccode\u003eLLMContext.create_image_message()\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eLLMContext.create_audio_message()\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eLLMContext.add_image_frame_message()\u003c/code\u003e\nand \u003ccode\u003eLLMContext.add_audio_frames_message()\u003c/code\u003e are now async methods. This fixes\nan issue where the asyncio event loop would be blocked while encoding audio or\nimages.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eConsumerProcessor\u003c/code\u003e now queues frames from the producer internally instead of\npushing them directly. This allows us to subclass consumer processors and\nmanipulate frames before they are pushed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eBaseTextFilter\u003c/code\u003e only require subclasses to implement the \u003ccode\u003efilter()\u003c/code\u003e method.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eExtracted the logic for retrying connections, and create a new \u003ccode\u003esend_with_retry\u003c/code\u003e\nmethod inside \u003ccode\u003eWebSocketService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRefactored \u003ccode\u003eDeepgramFluxSTTService\u003c/code\u003e to automatically reconnect if sending a\nmessage fails.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated all STT and TTS services to use consistent error handling pattern with\n\u003ccode\u003epush_error()\u003c/code\u003e method for better pipeline error event integration.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for \u003ccode\u003emaybe_capture_participant_camera()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003emaybe_capture_participant_screen()\u003c/code\u003e for \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e in the runner\nutils.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded Hindi support for Rime TTS services.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eGeminiTTSService\u003c/code\u003e to use Google Cloud Text-to-Speech streaming API\ninstead of the deprecated Gemini API. Now uses \u003ccode\u003ecredentials\u003c/code\u003e /\n\u003ccode\u003ecredentials_path\u003c/code\u003e for authentication. Significantly improved latency with streaming\nsynthesis.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated language mappings for the Google and Gemini TTS services to match\nofficial documentation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eDeprecated\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-deprecated-3\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Deprecated\" href=\"#deprecated-3\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eapi_key\u003c/code\u003e parameter in \u003ccode\u003eGeminiTTSService\u003c/code\u003e is deprecated. Sarvam Speech-to-Text service (\u003ccode\u003eSarvamSTTService\u003c/code\u003e) with\nstreaming WebSocket support for \u003ccode\u003esaarika\u003c/code\u003e (STT) and \u003ccode\u003esaaras\u003c/code\u003e (STT-translate)\nmodels.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for passing in a \u003ccode\u003eToolsSchema\u003c/code\u003e in lieu of a list of provider-\nspecific dicts when initializing \u003ccode\u003eOpenAIRealtimeLLMService\u003c/code\u003e or when updating\nit using \u003ccode\u003eLLMUpdateSettingsFrame\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.audio_out_silence_secs\u003c/code\u003e, which specifies how many\nseconds of silence to output when an \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e reaches the output\ntransport. This can help ensure that all audio data is fully delivered to\nclients.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.broadcast_frame()\u003c/code\u003e method. This will push two\ninstances of a given frame class, one upstream and the other downstream.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"await self.broadcast_frame(UserSpeakingFrame)\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003eawait\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003ebroadcast_frame\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-v\"\u003eUserSpeakingFrame\u003c/span\u003e)\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eMetricsLogObserver\u003c/code\u003e for logging performance metrics from \u003ccode\u003eMetricsFrame\u003c/code\u003e\ninstances. Supports filtering via \u003ccode\u003einclude_metrics\u003c/code\u003e parameter to control which\nmetrics types are logged (TTFB, processing time, LLM token usage, TTS usage,\nsmart turn metrics).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003epronunciation_dictionary_locators\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for loading external observers. You can now register custom\npipeline observers by setting the \u003ccode\u003ePIPECAT_OBSERVER_FILES\u003c/code\u003e environment\nvariable. This variable should contain a colon-separated list of Python files\n(e.g. \u003ccode\u003eexport PIPECAT_OBSERVER_FILES=\"observer1.py:observer2.py:...\"\u003c/code\u003e). Each\nfile must define a function with the following signature:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"async def create_observers(task: PipelineTask) -\u0026gt; Iterable[BaseObserver]:\n    ...\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003easync\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003edef\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003ecreate_observers\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003etask\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/span\u003e) \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e-\u0026gt;\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-v\"\u003eIterable\u003c/span\u003e[\u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003eBaseObserver\u003c/span\u003e]:\n    ...\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for new sonic-3 languages in \u003ccode\u003eCartesiaTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eCartesiaHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eEndTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e have an optional \u003ccode\u003ereason\u003c/code\u003e field to indicate why\nthe pipeline is being ended.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eCancelTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e have an optional \u003ccode\u003ereason\u003c/code\u003e field to\nindicate why the pipeline is being canceled. This can be also specified when\nyou cancel a task with \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask.cancel(reason=\"cancellation reason\")\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003einclude_prob_metrics\u003c/code\u003e parameter to Whisper STT services to enable access\nto probability metrics from transcription results.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded utility functions \u003ccode\u003eextract_whisper_probability()\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eextract_openai_gpt4o_probability()\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003eextract_deepgram_probability()\u003c/code\u003e to\nextract probability metrics from \u003ccode\u003eTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e objects for Whisper-based,\nOpenAI GPT-4o-transcribe, and Deepgram STT services respectively.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eLLMSwitcher.register_direct_function()\u003c/code\u003e. It works much like\n\u003ccode\u003eLLMSwitcher.register_function()\u003c/code\u003e in that it's a shorthand for registering\nfunctions on all LLMs in the switcher, but for direct functions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eLLMSwitcher.register_direct_function()\u003c/code\u003e. It works much like\n\u003ccode\u003eLLMSwitcher.register_function()\u003c/code\u003e in that it's a shorthand for registering\na function on all LLMs in the switcher, except this new method takes a direct\nfunction (a \u003ccode\u003eFunctionSchema\u003c/code\u003e-less function).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eMCPClient.get_tools_schema()\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eMCPClient.register_tools_schema()\u003c/code\u003e\nas a two-step alternative to \u003ccode\u003eMCPClient.register_tools()\u003c/code\u003e, to allow users to\npass MCP tools to, say, \u003ccode\u003eGeminiLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e (as well as other\nspeech-to-speech services) in the constructor.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for passing in an \u003ccode\u003eLLMSwicher\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eMCPClient.register_tools()\u003c/code\u003e\n(as well as the new \u003ccode\u003eMCPClient.register_tools_schema()\u003c/code\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003ecpu_count\u003c/code\u003e parameter to \u003ccode\u003eLocalSmartTurnAnalyzerV3\u003c/code\u003e. This is set to \u003ccode\u003e1\u003c/code\u003e\nby default for more predictable performance on low-CPU systems.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eChanged\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-changed-5\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Changed\" href=\"#changed-5\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003esimli-ai\u003c/code\u003e to 0.1.25.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eSTTMuteFilter\u003c/code\u003e no longer sends \u003ccode\u003eSTTMuteFrame\u003c/code\u003e to the STT service. The filter\nnow blocks frames locally without instructing the STT service to stop\nprocessing audio. This prevents inactivity-related errors (such as 409 errors\nfrom Google STT) while maintaining the same muting behavior at the application\nlevel. Important: The STTMuteFilter should be placed \u003cem\u003eafter\u003c/em\u003e the STT service\nitself.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eImproved \u003ccode\u003eGoogleSTTService\u003c/code\u003e error handling to properly catch gRPC \u003ccode\u003eAborted\u003c/code\u003e\nexceptions (corresponding to 409 errors) caused by stream inactivity. These\nexceptions are now logged at DEBUG level instead of ERROR level, since they\nindicate expected behavior when no audio is sent for 10+ seconds (e.g., during\nlong silences or when audio input is blocked). The service automatically\nreconnects when this occurs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBumped the \u003ccode\u003efastapi\u003c/code\u003e dependency's upperbound to \u003ccode\u003e\u0026lt;0.122.0\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated the default model for \u003ccode\u003eGoogleVertexLLMService\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003egemini-2.5-flash\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated the \u003ccode\u003eGoogleVertexLLMService\u003c/code\u003e to use the \u003ccode\u003eGoogleLLMService\u003c/code\u003e as a base\nclass instead of the \u003ccode\u003eOpenAILLMService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated STT and TTS services to pass through unverified language codes with a\nwarning instead of returning None. This allows developers to use newly\nsupported languages before Pipecat's service classes are updated, while still\nproviding guidance on verified languages.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eRemoved\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-removed-2\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Removed\" href=\"#removed-2\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoved \u003ccode\u003eneeds_mcp_alternate_schema()\u003c/code\u003e from \u003ccode\u003eLLMService\u003c/code\u003e. The mechanism that\nrelied on it went away.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-fixed-5\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Fixed\" href=\"#fixed-5\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRestore backwards compatibility for vision/image features (broken in 0.0.92)\nwhen using non-universal context and assistant aggregators.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed \u003ccode\u003eDeepgramSTTService._disconnect()\u003c/code\u003e to properly await \u003ccode\u003eis_connected()\u003c/code\u003e\nmethod call, which is an async coroutine in the Deepgram SDK.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where the \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCRequest\u003c/code\u003e dataclass in runner would scrub\narbitrary request data from client due to camelCase typing. This fixes data\npassthrough for JS clients where \u003ccode\u003eAPIRequest\u003c/code\u003e is used.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a bug in \u003ccode\u003eGeminiLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e where in some circumstances it wouldn't\nrespond after a tool call.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp \u003ccode\u003eerror\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003edaily-python\u003c/code\u003e to 0.21.0.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eSimliVideoService\u003c/code\u003e now accepts \u003ccode\u003eapi_key\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eface_id\u003c/code\u003e parameters directly,\nwith optional \u003ccode\u003eparams\u003c/code\u003e for \u003ccode\u003emax_session_length\u003c/code\u003e and and\n\u003ccode\u003eCartesiaHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eFunctionFilter\u003c/code\u003e now has a The service now only includes\ninference parameters that are explicitly set, and \u003ccode\u003eInputParams\u003c/code\u003e defaults have\nbeen changed to \u003ccode\u003eNone\u003c/code\u003e to rely on AWS Bedrock's built-in model defaults.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eRivaSegmentedSTTService\u003c/code\u003e where a runtime error occurred due\nto a mismatch in the \u003ccode\u003e_handle_transcription\u003c/code\u003e method's signature.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed multiple pipeline task cancellation issues. \u003ccode\u003easyncio.CancelledError\u003c/code\u003e is\nnow handled properly in \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e making it possible to cancel an asyncio\ntask that it's executing a \u003ccode\u003ePipelineRunner\u003c/code\u003e cleanly. Also,\n\u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask.cancel()\u003c/code\u003e does not block anymore waiting for the \u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e\nto reach the end of the pipeline (going back to the behavior in \u0026lt; 0.0.83).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e where\nthe Flash models would split words, resulting in a space being inserted\nbetween words.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where audio filters' \u003ccode\u003estop()\u003c/code\u003e would not be called when using\n\u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e, where\n\u003ccode\u003eapply_text_normalization\u003c/code\u003e was incorrectly set as a query parameter. It's now\nbeing added as a request parameter.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where \u003ccode\u003eRimeHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ePiperTTSService\u003c/code\u003e could generate\nincorrectly 16-bit aligned audio frames, potentially leading to internal\nerrors or static This event will get fired\nwhen an \u003ccode\u003eErrorFrame\u003c/code\u003e is pushed (use \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.push_error()\u003c/code\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"@task.event_handler(\u0026quot;on_pipeline_error\u0026quot;)\nasync def on_pipeline_error(task: PipelineTask, frame: ErrorFrame):\n    ...\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e@\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003etask\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eevent_handler\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"on_pipeline_error\"\u003c/span\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003easync\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003edef\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eon_pipeline_error\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003etask\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/span\u003e, \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eframe\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003eErrorFrame\u003c/span\u003e):\n    ...\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a \u003ccode\u003eservice_tier\u003c/code\u003e \u003ccode\u003eInputParam\u003c/code\u003e to the \u003ccode\u003eBaseOpenAILLMService\u003c/code\u003e. This\nparameter can influence the latency of the response. \u003ccode\u003eHeyGenTransport\u003c/code\u003e. This is an integration for HeyGen Interactive\nAvatar. A video service that handles audio streaming and requests HeyGen to\ngenerate avatar video responses. (see \u003ca href=\"https://www.heygen.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.heygen.com/\u003c/a\u003e). When used, the\nPipecat bot joins the same virtual room as the HeyGen Avatar and the user.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support to \u003ccode\u003eTwilioFrameSerializer\u003c/code\u003e for \u003ccode\u003eregion\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eedge\u003c/code\u003e settings.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for using universal \u003ccode\u003eLLMContext\u003c/code\u003e with:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLLMLogObserver\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGatedLLMContextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e (formerly \u003ccode\u003eGatedOpenAILLMContextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLangchainProcessor\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eMem0MemoryService\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eStrandsAgentProcessor\u003c/code\u003e which allows you to use the Strands Agents\nframework to build your voice agents.\nSee \u003ca href=\"https://strandsagents.com\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://strandsagents.com\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsSTTService\u003c/code\u003e for speech-to-text transcription.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a peer connection monitor to the \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCConnection\u003c/code\u003e that\nautomatically disconnects if the connection fails to establish within\nthe timeout (1 minute by default).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded memory cleanup improvements to reduce memory peaks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eon_before_process_frame\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eon_after_process_frame\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eon_before_push_frame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eon_after_push_frame\u003c/code\u003e. These are synchronous events\nthat get called before and after a frame is processed or pushed. Note that\nthese events are synchrnous so they should ideally perform lightweight tasks\nin order to not block the pipeline. See\n\u003ccode\u003eexamples/foundational/45-before-and-after-events.py\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eon_before_leave\u003c/code\u003e synchronous event to \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eon_before_disconnect\u003c/code\u003e synchronous event to \u003ccode\u003eLiveKitTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIt is now possible to register synchronous event handlers. By default, all\nevent handlers are executed in a separate task. However, in some cases we want\nto guarantee order of execution, for example, executing something before\ndisconnecting a transport.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"self._register_event_handler(\u0026quot;on_event_name\u0026quot;, sync=True)\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eself\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e_register_event_handler\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"on_event_name\"\u003c/span\u003e, \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003esync\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eTrue\u003c/span\u003e)\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for global location in \u003ccode\u003eGoogleVertexLLMService\u003c/code\u003e. The service now\nsupports both regional locations (e.g., \"us-east4\") and the \"global\" location\nfor Vertex AI endpoints. When using \"global\" location, the service will use\n\u003ccode\u003eaiplatform.googleapis.com\u003c/code\u003e as the API host instead of the regional format.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eon_pipeline_finished\u003c/code\u003e event to \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e. This event will get\nfired when the pipeline is done running. This can be the result of a\n\u003ccode\u003eStopFrame\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" \u003ccode\u003ewrite_video_frame\u003c/code\u003e now\nreturn a boolean to indicate if the transport implementation was able to write\nthe given frame or not.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated Silero VAD model to v6.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003elivekit\u003c/code\u003e to 1.0.13.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etorch\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etorchaudio\u003c/code\u003e are no longer required for running Smart Turn\nlocally. This avoids gigabytes of dependencies being installed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003ewebsockets\u003c/code\u003e dependency to support version 15.0. Removed deprecated\nusage of \u003ccode\u003eConnectionClosed.code\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eConnectionClosed.reason\u003c/code\u003e attributes in\n\u003ccode\u003eAWSTranscribeSTTService\u003c/code\u003e for compatibility.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRefactored \u003ccode\u003epyproject.toml\u003c/code\u003e to reduce websockets dependency repetition using\nself-referencing extras. All websockets-dependent services now reference a\nshared \u003ccode\u003ewebsockets-base\u003c/code\u003e extra.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eDeprecated\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-deprecated-10\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Deprecated\" href=\"#deprecated-10\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGladiaSTTService\u003c/code\u003e's \u003ccode\u003econfidence\u003c/code\u003e arg is deprecated. \u003ccode\u003econfidence\u003c/code\u003e is no\nlonger needed to determine which transcription or translation frames to\nemit.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e events \u003ccode\u003eon_pipeline_stopped\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eon_pipeline_ended\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eon_pipeline_cancelled\u003c/code\u003e are now deprecated. Use \u003ccode\u003eon_pipeline_finished\u003c/code\u003e\ninstead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSupport for the RTVI \u003ccode\u003eappend-to-context\u003c/code\u003e event, in lieu of the new \u003ccode\u003esend-text\u003c/code\u003e\nevent and making way for future events like \u003ccode\u003esend-image\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-fixed-12\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Fixed\" href=\"#fixed-12\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where the pipeline could freeze if a task cancellation never\ncompleted because a third-party library swallowed asyncio.CancelledError. We\nnow apply a timeout to task cancellations to prevent these freezes. If the\ntimeout is reached, the system logs warnings and leaves dangling tasks behind,\nwhich can help diagnose where cancellation is being blocked.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an \u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e issues that was causing user audio to be\nmissing in stereo recordings causing bot and user overlaps.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eBaseOutputTransport\u003c/code\u003e issue that could produce large saved\n\u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e files when using an audio mixer.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003ePipelineRunner\u003c/code\u003e issue on Windows where setting up SIGINT and SIGTERM\nwas raising an exception.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where multiple handlers for an event would not run in parallel.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport.sip_call_transfer()\u003c/code\u003e to automatically use the session\nID from the \u003ccode\u003eon_dialin_connected\u003c/code\u003e event, when not explicitly provided. Now\nsupports cold transfers (from incoming dial-in calls) by automatically\ntracking session IDs from connection events.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a memory leak in \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e. In \u003ccode\u003eaiortc\u003c/code\u003e, when you receive\na \u003ccode\u003eMediaStreamTrack\u003c/code\u003e (audio or video), frames are produced asynchronously. If\nthe code never consumes these frames, they are queued in memory, causing a\nmemory leak.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eAsyncAITTSService\u003c/code\u003e, where \u003ccode\u003eTTSTextFrames\u003c/code\u003e were not being\npushed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue that would cause \u003ccode\u003epush_interruption_task_frame_and_wait()\u003c/code\u003e to\nnot wait if a previous interruption had already happened.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a couple of bugs in \u003ccode\u003eServiceSwitcher\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUsing multiple \u003ccode\u003eServiceSwitcher\u003c/code\u003es in a pipeline would result in an error.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eServiceSwitcherFrame\u003c/code\u003es (such as \u003ccode\u003eManuallySwitchServiceFrame\u003c/code\u003es) were having\nan effect too early, essentially \"jumping the queue\" in terms of pipeline\nframe ordering.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a self-cancellation deadlock in \u003ccode\u003eUserIdleProcessor\u003c/code\u003e when returning\n\u003ccode\u003eFalse\u003c/code\u003e from an idle callback. The task now terminates naturally instead of\nattempting to cancel itself.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e where a recording is not created\nwhen a bot speaks and user input is blocked.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eFastAPIWebsocketTransport\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e issue where\n\u003ccode\u003eon_client_disconnected\u003c/code\u003e would be triggered when the bot ends the\nconversation. That is, \u003ccode\u003eon_client_disconnected\u003c/code\u003e should only be triggered when\nthe remote client actually disconnects.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eHeyGenVideoService\u003c/code\u003e where the \u003ccode\u003eBotStartedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e\nwas blocked from moving through the Pipeline.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e[0.0.85] - dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eAzureSTTService\u003c/code\u003e now pushes interim transcriptions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003evoice_cloning_key\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eGoogleTTSService\u003c/code\u003e to support custom cloned\nvoices.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003espeaking_rate\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eGoogleTTSService.InputParams\u003c/code\u003e to control the\nspeaking rate.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a \u003ccode\u003espeed\u003c/code\u003e arg to \u003ccode\u003eOpenAITTSService\u003c/code\u003e to control the speed of the voice\nresponse.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.push_interruption_task_frame_and_wait()\u003c/code\u003e. Use this\nmethod to programatically interrupt the bot from any part of the\npipeline. This guarantees that all the processors in the pipeline are\ninterrupted in order (from upstream to downstream). Internally, this works by\nfirst pushing an \u003ccode\u003eInterruptionTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e upstream until it reaches the\npipeline task. The pipeline task then generates an \u003ccode\u003eInterruptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e, which\nflows downstream through all processors. Once the \u003ccode\u003eInterruptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e has\nreaches the processor waiting for the interruption, the function returns and\nexecution continues after the call. Think of it as sending an upstream request\nfor interruption and waiting until the acknowledgment flows back downstream.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new base \u003ccode\u003eTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e (which is a system frame). This is the base class\nfor all task frames (\u003ccode\u003eEndTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eCancelTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e, etc.) that are meant\nto be pushed upstream to reach the pipeline task.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eExpanded support for universal \u003ccode\u003eLLMContext\u003c/code\u003e to the AWS Bedrock LLM service.\nUsing the universal \u003ccode\u003eLLMContext\u003c/code\u003e and associated \u003ccode\u003eLLMContextAggregatorPair\u003c/code\u003e is\na pre-requisite for using \u003ccode\u003eLLMSwitcher\u003c/code\u003e to switch between LLMs at runtime.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new fields to the development runner's \u003ccode\u003eparse_telephony_websocket\u003c/code\u003e\nmethod in support of providing dynamic data to a bot.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTwilio: Added a new \u003ccode\u003ebody\u003c/code\u003e parameter, which parses the websocket message\nfor \u003ccode\u003ecustomParameters\u003c/code\u003e. Provide data via the \u003ccode\u003eParameter\u003c/code\u003e nouns in your\nTwiML to use this feature.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTelnyx \u0026amp; Exotel: Both providers make the \u003ccode\u003eto\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003efrom\u003c/code\u003e phone numbers\navailable in the websocket messages. You can now access these numbers as\n\u003ccode\u003ecall_data[\"to\"]\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ecall_data[\"from\"]\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNote: Each telephony provider offers different features. Refer to the\ncorresponding example in \u003ccode\u003epipecat-examples\u003c/code\u003e to see how to pass custom data\nto your bot.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003ebody\u003c/code\u003e to the \u003ccode\u003eWebsocketRunnerArguments\u003c/code\u003e as an optional parameter.\nCustom \u003ccode\u003ebody\u003c/code\u003e information can be passed from the server into the bot file via\nthe \u003ccode\u003ebot()\u003c/code\u003e method using this new parameter.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded video streaming support to \u003ccode\u003eLiveKitTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eOpenAIRealtimeLLMService\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eAzureRealtimeLLMService\u003c/code\u003e which provide\naccess to OpenAI Realtime.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\"
