Using the\nuniversal \u003ccode\u003eLLMContext\u003c/code\u003e and associated \u003ccode\u003eLLMContextAggregatorPair\u003c/code\u003e is a\npre-requisite for using \u003ccode\u003eLLMSwitcher\u003c/code\u003e to switch between LLMs at runtime.\nHere are the newly-supported services:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAzure\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCerebras\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeepseek\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFireworks AI\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGoogle Vertex AI\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGrok\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eGroq\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMistral\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNVIDIA NIM\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOllama\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOpenPipe\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOpenRouter\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePerplexity\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eQwen\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSambaNova\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTogether.ai\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for WhatsApp User-initiated Calls.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new audio filter \u003ccode\u003eAICFilter\u003c/code\u003e, speech enhancement for improving VAD/STT\nperformance, no ONNX dependency.\nSee \u003ca href=\"https://ai-coustics.com/sdk/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://ai-coustics.com/sdk/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a timeout around cancel input tasks to prevent indefinite hangs when\ncancellation is swallowed by third-party code.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003epipecat.extensions.ivr\u003c/code\u003e for automated IVR system navigation with\nconfigurable goals and conversation handling. Supports DTMF input, verbal\nresponses, and intelligent menu traversal.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBasic usage:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"from pipecat.extensions.ivr.ivr_navigator import IVRNavigator\n\n# Create IVR navigator with your dir=\"auto\"\u003eIn the rare case you don’t have a context aggregator in your pipeline, then\nyou may continue using a context frame.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for switching between audio+text to text-only modes within the\nsame pipeline. This is done by pushing\n\u003ccode\u003eLLMConfigureOutputFrame(skip_tts=True)\u003c/code\u003e to enter text-only mode, and\ndisabling it to return to audio+text. The LLM will still generate tokens and\nadd them to the context, but they will not be sent to TTS.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eskip_tts\u003c/code\u003e field to \u003ccode\u003eTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e. This lets a text frame bypass TTS while\nstill being included in the LLM context. Useful for cases like structured text\nthat isn’t meant to be spoken but should still contribute to context.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a \u003ccode\u003ecancel_timeout_secs\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e which defines how\nlong the pipeline has to complete cancellation. When \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask.cancel()\u003c/code\u003e\nis called, a \u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e is pushed through the pipeline and must reach the\nend. If it does not reach the end within the specified time, a warning is\nshown and the wait is aborted.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a new \"universal\" (LLM-agnostic) \u003ccode\u003eLLMContext\u003c/code\u003e and accompanying\n\u003ccode\u003eLLMContextAggregatorPair\u003c/code\u003e, which will eventually replace \u003ccode\u003eOpenAILLMContext\u003c/code\u003e\n(and the other under-the-hood contexts) and the other context aggregators.\nThe new universal \u003ccode\u003eLLMContext\u003c/code\u003e machinery allows a single context to be shared\nbetween different LLMs, enabling runtime LLM switching and scenarios like\nfailover.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFrom the developer's point of view, switching to using the new universal\ncontext machinery will usually be a matter of going from this:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative \u003ccode\u003epipecat.extensions.voicemail\u003c/code\u003e, a module for detecting voicemail vs.\nlive conversation, primarily intended for use in outbound calling scenarios.\nThe voicemail module is optimized for text LLMs only.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new frames to the \u003ccode\u003eidle_timeout_frames\u003c/code\u003e arg: \u003ccode\u003eTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eInterimTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eUserStartedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e, and\n\u003ccode\u003eUserStoppedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e. These additions serve as indicators of user\nactivity in the pipeline idle detection logic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAllow passing custom pipeline sink and source processors to a\n\u003ccode\u003ePipeline\u003c/code\u003e. Pipeline source and sink processors are used to know and control\nwhat's coming in and out of a \u003ccode\u003ePipeline\u003c/code\u003e processor.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.pause_processing_system_frames()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.resume_processing_system_frames()\u003c/code\u003e. These allow to pause and\nresume the processing of system frame.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eon_process_frame()\u003c/code\u003e observer method which makes it possible to know\nwhen a frame is being processed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.entry_processor()\u003c/code\u003e method. This allows you to access\nthe first non-compound processor in a pipeline.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor\u003c/code\u003e properties \u003ccode\u003eprocessors\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003enext\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eprevious\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e now supports additional runtime changes to the \u003ccode\u003emodel\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003elanguage\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003evoice_settings\u003c/code\u003e parameters.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eapply_text_normalization\u003c/code\u003e support to \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eMistralLLMService\u003c/code\u003e, using Mistral's chat completion API.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded the ability to retry executing a chat completion after a timeout period\nfor \u003ccode\u003eOpenAILLMService\u003c/code\u003e and its subclasses, \u003ccode\u003eAnthropicLLMService\u003c/code\u003e, and\n\u003ccode\u003eAWSBedrockLLMService\u003c/code\u003e. The LLM services accept new args:\n\u003ccode\u003eretry_timeout_secs\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eretry_on_timeout\u003c/code\u003e. This feature is disabled by\ndefault.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" \u003ccode\u003eGeminiTTSService\u003c/code\u003e which uses Google Gemini to generate TTS output. The\nGemini model can be prompted to insert styled speech to control the TTS\noutput.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded Exotel support to Pipecat's development runner. You can now connect\nusing the runner with \u003ccode\u003euv run bot.py -t exotel\u003c/code\u003e and an ngrok connection to\nHTTP port 7860.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eenable_direct_mode\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor\u003c/code\u003e. The direct mode is\nfor processors which require very little I/O or compute resources, that is\nprocessors that can perform their task almost immediately. These type of\nprocessors don't need any of the internal tasks and queues usually created by\nframe processors which means overall application performance might be slightly\nincreased. Use with care.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded TTFB metrics for \u003ccode\u003eHeyGenVideoService\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eTavusVideoService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eendpoint_id\u003c/code\u003e parameter to \u003ccode\u003eAzureSTTService\u003c/code\u003e. latency of the \u003ccode\u003eHeyGenVideoService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eImproved some frame processors performance by using the new frame processor\ndirect mode. In direct mode a frame processor will process frames right away\navoiding the need for internal queues and tasks. This is useful for some\nsimple processors. For example, in processors that wrap other processors\n(e.g. \u003ccode\u003ePipeline\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eParallelPipeline\u003c/code\u003e), we add one processor before and one\nafter the wrapped processors (internally, you will see them as sources and\nsinks). These sources and sinks don't do any special processing and they\nbasically forward frames. So, for these simple processors we now enable the\nnew direct mode which avoids creating any internal tasks (and queues) and\ntherefore improves performance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" is deprecated, push a \u003ccode\u003eTTSSpeakFrame\u003c/code\u003e instead. Calling\nfunctions directly is a discouraged pattern in Pipecat because, for example,\nit might cause issues with frame ordering.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLLMMessagesFrame\u003c/code\u003e is deprecated, in favor of either:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLLMMessagesUpdateFrame\u003c/code\u003e with \u003ccode\u003erun_llm=True\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eOpenAILLMContextFrame\u003c/code\u003e with desired messages in a new context\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLLMUserResponseAggregator\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eLLMAssistantResponseAggregator\u003c/code\u003e are\ndeprecated, as they depended on the now-deprecated \u003ccode\u003eLLMMessagesFrame\u003c/code\u003e. Use\n\u003ccode\u003eLLMUserContextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eLLMAssistantResponseAggregator\u003c/code\u003e (or\nLLM-specific subclasses thereof) instead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e[0.0.78] - 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eSonioxSTTService\u003c/code\u003e using Soniox's STT websocket API.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eenable_emulated_vad_interruptions\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eLLMUserAggregatorParams\u003c/code\u003e.\nWhen user speech is emulated (e.g. when a transcription is received but\nVAD doesn't detect speech), this parameter controls whether the emulated\nspeech can interrupt the bot. Default is False (emulated speech is ignored\nwhile the bot is speaking).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003ehandle_sigint\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ehandle_sigterm\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eRunnerArguments\u003c/code\u003e. This\nallows applications to know what settings they should use for the environment\nthey are running on. Also, added \u003ccode\u003epipeline_idle_timeout_secs\u003c/code\u003e to be able to\ncontrol the \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e idle timeout.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eprocessor\u003c/code\u003e field to \u003ccode\u003eErrorFrame\u003c/code\u003e to indicate \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor\u003c/code\u003e that\ngenerated the error.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new language support for \u003ccode\u003eAWSTranscribeSTTService\u003c/code\u003e. All languages\nsupporting streaming data input are now supported:\n\u003ca href=\"https://docs.aws.amazon.com/transcribe/latest/dg/supported-languages.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://docs.aws.amazon.com/transcribe/latest/dg/supported-languages.html\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for Simli Trinity Avatars. A new \u003ccode\u003eis_trinity_avatar\u003c/code\u003e parameter\nhas been introduced to specify whether the provided \u003ccode\u003efaceId\u003c/code\u003e corresponds to a\nTrinity avatar, which is required for optimal Trinity avatar performance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe development runner how handles custom \u003ccode\u003ebody\u003c/code\u003e data for \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\nThe \u003ccode\u003ebody\u003c/code\u003e data is passed to the Pipecat client. You can POST to the \u003ccode\u003e/start\u003c/code\u003e\nendpoint with a request body of:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"{\n    \u0026quot;createDailyRoom\u0026quot;: true,\n    \u0026quot;dailyRoomProperties\u0026quot;: { \u0026quot;start_video_off\u0026quot;: true },\n    \u0026quot;body\u0026quot;: { \u0026quot;custom_data\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;value\u0026quot; }\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003e{\n    \"createDailyRoom\": true,\n    \"dailyRoomProperties\": { \"start_video_off\": true },\n    \"body\": { \"custom_data\": \"value\" }\n}\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003ebody\u003c/code\u003e information is parsed and used in the application. The\n\u003ccode\u003edailyRoomProperties\u003c/code\u003e are currently not handled.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded detailed latency logging to \u003ccode\u003eUserBotLatencyLogObserver\u003c/code\u003e, capturing\naverage response time between user stop and bot start, as well as minimum and\nmaximum response latency.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded Chinese, Japanese, Korean word timestamp support to\n\u003ccode\u003eCartesiaTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eregion\u003c/code\u003e parameter to \u003ccode\u003eGladiaSTTService\u003c/code\u003e. Accepted values: eu-west\n(default), us-west.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eChanged\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-changed-19\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Changed\" href=\"#changed-19\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSystem frames are now queued. Before, system frames could be generated from\nany task and would not guarantee any order which was causing undesired\nbehavior. Also, it was possible to get into some rare recursion issues because\nof the way system frames were executed (they were executed in-place, meaning\ncalling \u003ccode\u003epush_frame()\u003c/code\u003e would finish after the system frame traversed all the\npipeline). This makes system frames more deterministic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eChanged the default model for both \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eeleven_turbo_v2_5\u003c/code\u003e. The rationale for this\nchange is that the Turbo v2.5 model exhibits the most stable voice quality\nalong with very low latency TTFB; latencies are on par with the Flash v2.5\nmodel. Also, the Turbo v2.5 model outputs word/timestamp alignment data with\ncorrect spacing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe development runners \u003ccode\u003e/connect\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003e/start\u003c/code\u003e endpoint now both return\n\u003ccode\u003edailyRoom\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003edailyToken\u003c/code\u003e in place of the previous \u003ccode\u003eroom_url\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etoken\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated the \u003ccode\u003epipecat.runner.daily\u003c/code\u003e utility to only a take \u003ccode\u003eDAILY_API_URL\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eDAILY_SAMPLE_ROOM_URL\u003c/code\u003e environment variables instead of argparsing \u003ccode\u003e-u\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003e-k\u003c/code\u003e, respectively.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003edaily-python\u003c/code\u003e to 0.19.6.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eChanged \u003ccode\u003eTavusVideoService\u003c/code\u003e to send audio or video frames only after the\ntransport is ready, preventing warning messages at startup.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe development runner now strips any provided protocol (e.g. https://) from\nthe proxy address and issues a warning. It also strips trailing \u003ccode\u003e/\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eDeprecated\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-deprecated-15\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Deprecated\" href=\"#deprecated-15\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIn the \u003ccode\u003epipecat.runner.daily\u003c/code\u003e, the \u003ccode\u003econfigure_with_args()\u003c/code\u003e function is\ndeprecated. Use the \u003ccode\u003econfigure()\u003c/code\u003e function instead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe development runner's \u003ccode\u003e/connect\u003c/code\u003e endpoint is deprecated and will be\nremoved in a future version. Use the \u003ccode\u003e/start\u003c/code\u003e endpoint in its place. In the\nmeantime, both endpoints work and deliver equivalent functionality.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e issue that would result in an unhandled\n\u003ccode\u003econcurrent.futures.CancelledError\u003c/code\u003e when a future is cancelled.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eRivaSTTService\u003c/code\u003e issue that would result in an unhandled\n\u003ccode\u003econcurrent.futures.CancelledError\u003c/code\u003e when a future is cancelled when reading\nfrom the audio chunks from the incoming audio stream.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in the \u003ccode\u003eBaseOutputTransport\u003c/code\u003e, mainly reproducible with\n\u003ccode\u003eFastAPIWebsocketOutputTransport\u003c/code\u003e when the audio mixer was enabled, where the\nloop could consume 100% CPU by continuously returning without delay, preventing\nother asyncio tasks (such as cancellation or shutdown signals) from being\nprocessed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where \u003ccode\u003eBotStartedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eBotStoppedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e\nwere not emitted when using \u003ccode\u003eTavusVideoService\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eHeyGenVideoService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eLiveKitTransport\u003c/code\u003e where empty \u003ccode\u003eAudioRawFrame\u003c/code\u003es were pushed\ndown the pipeline. This resulted in warnings by the STT processor.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed \u003ccode\u003ePiperTTSService\u003c/code\u003e to send text as a JSON object in the request body,\nresolving compatibility with Piper's HTTP API.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue with the \u003ccode\u003eTavusVideoService\u003c/code\u003e where an error was thrown due to\nmissing transcription callbacks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an \u003ccode\u003e\u0026gt;=0.115.6,\u0026lt;0.117.0\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etorch\u003c/code\u003e/\u003ccode\u003etorchaudio\u003c/code\u003e: Changed from exact This removes the log from appearing\nin Pipecat logs upon leaving.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpgraded the \u003ccode\u003ewebsockets\u003c/code\u003e implementation to the new asyncio implementation.\nAlong with this change, we're updating support for versions \u0026gt;=13.1.0 and\n\u0026lt;15.0.0. \u003ccode\u003eMiniMaxHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e with a \u003ccode\u003ebase_url\u003c/code\u003e arg where you can specify\nthe Global endpoint (default) or Mainland dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed \u003ccode\u003ePiperTTSService\u003c/code\u003e to work with newer Piper GPL.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a race condition dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eGoogleLLMService\u003c/code\u003e where interruptions did not work when an\ninterruption strategy was used.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in the \u003ccode\u003eTranscriptProcessor\u003c/code\u003e where newline characters could\ncause the transcript output to be corrupted (e.g. missing all spaces).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e when using \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e\nwhere, if the microphone was muted, track timing was not respected.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an error that occurs when pushing an \u003ccode\u003eLLMMessagesFrame\u003c/code\u003e. Only some LLM\nservices, like Grok, are impacted by this issue. The fix is to remove the\noptional \u003ccode\u003ename\u003c/code\u003e property that was being added to the message.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e that caused garbled audio when\n\u003ccode\u003eenable_turn_audio\u003c/code\u003e was enabled and audio resampling was required.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a dependency issue for uv users where an \u003ccode\u003ellvmlite\u003c/code\u003e version required\npython 3.9.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eMiniMaxHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e where the \u003ccode\u003epitch\u003c/code\u003e param was the\nincorrect type.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue with OpenTelemetry tracing where the \u003ccode\u003eenable_tracing\u003c/code\u003e flag did\nnot disable the internal tracing decorator functions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eOLLamaLLMService\u003c/code\u003e where kwargs were not passed correctly\nto the parent class.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e where the word/timestamp pairs were\ncalculating word boundaries incorrectly.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where, in some edge cases, the\n\u003ccode\u003eEmulateUserStartedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e could be created even if we didn't have a\ntranscription.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eGoogleLLMContext\u003c/code\u003e where it would inject the\n\u003ccode\u003esystem_message\u003c/code\u003e as a \"user\" message into cases where it was not meant to;\nit was only meant to do that when there were no \"regular\" (non-function-call)\nmessages in the context, to ensure that inference would run properly.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eLiveKitTransport\u003c/code\u003e where the \u003ccode\u003eon_audio_track_subscribed\u003c/code\u003e was\nnever emitted.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv RTVI's handling of \u003ccode\u003eappend-to-context\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where using audio input with a sample rate requiring resampling\ncould result in empty audio being passed to STT services, causing errors.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed the VAD analyzer to process the full audio buffer as long as it contains\nmore than the minimum required bytes per iteration, instead of only analyzing\nthe first chunk.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in ParallelPipeline that caused errors when attempting to drain\nthe queues.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue with emulated VAD timeout inconsistency in\n\u003ccode\u003eLLMUserContextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e. Previously, emulated VAD scenarios (where\ntranscription is received without VAD detection) used a hardcoded\n\u003ccode\u003eaggregation_timeout\u003c/code\u003e (default 0.5s) instead of matching the VAD's\n\u003ccode\u003estop_secs\u003c/code\u003e parameter (default 0.8s). This created different user experiences\nbetween real VAD and emulated VAD scenarios. Now, emulated VAD timeouts\nautomatically synchronize with the VAD's \u003ccode\u003estop_secs\u003c/code\u003e parameter.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFix a pipeline freeze when using AWS Nova Sonic, which would occur if the\nuser started early, while the bot was still working through\n\u003ccode\u003etrigger_assistant_response()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eRTVIObserver\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eRTVIProcessor\u003c/code\u003e to match the new RTVI 1.0.0 protocol.\nThis includes:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecating support for all messages related to service configuaration and\nactions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding support for obtaining and logging data about client, including its\nRTVI version and optionally included system information (OS/browser/etc.)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding support for handling the new \u003ccode\u003eclient-message\u003c/code\u003e RTVI message through\neither a \u003ccode\u003eon_client_message\u003c/code\u003e event handler or listening for a new\n\u003ccode\u003eRTVIClientMessageFrame\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding support for responding to a \u003ccode\u003eclient-message\u003c/code\u003e with a \u003ccode\u003eserver-response\u003c/code\u003e\nvia either a direct call on the \u003ccode\u003eRTVIProcessor\u003c/code\u003e or via pushing a new\n\u003ccode\u003eRTVIServerResponseFrame\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdding built-in support for handling the new \u003ccode\u003eappend-to-context\u003c/code\u003e RTVI message\nwhich allows a client to add to the user or assistant llm context. No extra\ncode is required for supporting this behavior.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdating all JavaScript and React client RTVI examples to use versions 1.0.0\nof the clients.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eGet started migrating to RTVI protocol 1.0.0 by following the migration guide:\n\u003ca href=\"https://docs.pipecat.ai/client/migration-guide\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://docs.pipecat.ai/client/migration-guide\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRefactored \u003ccode\u003eAWSBedrockLLMService\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eAWSPollyTTSService\u003c/code\u003e to work\nasynchronously using \u003ccode\u003eaioboto3\u003c/code\u003e instead of the \u003ccode\u003eboto3\u003c/code\u003e library.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eUserIdleProcessor\u003c/code\u003e now handles the scenario where function calls take\nlonger than the idle timeout duration. This allows you to use the\n\u003ccode\u003eUserIdleProcessor\u003c/code\u003e in conjunction with function calls that take a while to\nreturn a result.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" \u003ccode\u003eSpeechmaticsSTTService\u003c/code\u003e. This service provides\nreal-time speech-to-text transcription using the Speechmatics API. It supports\npartial and final transcriptions, multiple languages, various audio formats,\nand speaker diarization.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003enormalize\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003emodel_id\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eFishAudioTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003ehttp_options\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003eGoogleLLMService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003erun_llm\u003c/code\u003e field to \u003ccode\u003eLLMMessagesAppendFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eLLMMessagesUpdateFrame\u003c/code\u003e\nframes. If true, a context frame will be pushed triggering the LLM to respond.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a new \u003ccode\u003eSOXRStreamAudioResampler\u003c/code\u003e for processing audio in chunks or\nstreams. If you write your own processor and need to use an audio resampler,\nuse the new \u003ccode\u003ecreate_stream_resampler()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eDailyParams.audio_in_user_tracks\u003c/code\u003e to allow receiving one track per\nuser (default) or a single track from the room (all participants mixed).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for providing \"direct\" functions, which don't need an\naccompanying \u003ccode\u003eFunctionSchema\u003c/code\u003e or function definition dict. Instead, metadata\n(i.e. \u003ccode\u003ename\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003edescription\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eproperties\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003erequired\u003c/code\u003e) are automatically\nextracted from a combination of the function signature and docstring.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUsage:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"# \u0026quot;Direct\u0026quot; function\n# `params` must be the first parameter\nasync def do_something(params: FunctionCallParams, foo: int, bar: str = \u0026quot;\u0026quot;):\n  \u0026quot;\u0026quot;\u0026quot;\n  Do something interesting.\n\n  Args:\n    foo (int): The foo to do something interesting with.\n    bar (string): The bar to do something interesting with.\n  \u0026quot;\u0026quot;\u0026quot;\n\n  result = await process(foo, bar)\n  await params.result_callback({\u0026quot;result\u0026quot;: result})\n\n# ...\n\nllm.register_direct_function(do_something)\n\n# ...\n\ntools = ToolsSchema(standard_tools=[do_something])\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e# \"Direct\" populated in the \u003ccode\u003eTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eInterimTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e when using a transport that provides a \u003ccode\u003euser_id\u003c/code\u003e,\nlike \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eLiveKitTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003ewatchdog_coroutine()\u003c/code\u003e. This is a watchdog helper for couroutines. So,\nif you have a coroutine that is waiting for a result and that takes a long\ntime, you will need to wrap it with \u003ccode\u003ewatchdog_coroutine()\u003c/code\u003e so the watchdog\ntimers are reset regularly.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003esession_token\u003c/code\u003e parameter to \u003ccode\u003eAWSNovaSonicLLMService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded Gemini Multimodal Live File API for uploading, fetching, listing, and\ndeleting files. See \u003ccode\u003e26f-gemini-live-files-api.py\u003c/code\u003e for example usage.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 diagnose and prevent potential\nPipeline freezes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eWatchdogQueue\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eWatchdogPriorityQueue\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eWatchdogEvent\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eWatchdogAsyncIterator\u003c/code\u003e. These helper utilities reset watchdog timers\nappropriately before they expire. When watchdog timers are disabled, the\nutilities behave as standard counterparts without side effects.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduce task watchdog timers. Watchdog timers are used to detect if a\nPipecat task is taking longer than expected (by default 5 seconds). Watchdog\ntimers are disabled by default and can be enabled globally by passing\n\u003ccode\u003eenable_watchdog_timers\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e constructor. It is\npossible to change the default watchdog timer timeout by using the\n\u003ccode\u003ewatchdog_timeout\u003c/code\u003e argument. You can also log how long it takes to reset the\nwatchdog timers which is done with the \u003ccode\u003eenable_watchdog_logging\u003c/code\u003e. You can\ncontrol all these settings per each frame processor or even per task. That is,\nyou can set \u003ccode\u003eenable_watchdog_timers\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eenable_watchdog_logging\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003ewatchdog_timeout\u003c/code\u003e when creating any frame processor through their constructor\narguments or when you create a task with \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.create_task()\u003c/code\u003e. Note\nthat watchdog timers only work with Pipecat tasks and will not work if you use\n\u003ccode\u003easycio.create_task()\u003c/code\u003e or similar.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003elexicon_names\u003c/code\u003e parameter to \u003ccode\u003eAWSPollyTTSService.InputParams\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded reconnection logic and audio buffer management to \u003ccode\u003eGladiaSTTService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eTurnTrackingObserver\u003c/code\u003e now ends a turn upon observing an \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e or\n\u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded Polish support to \u003ccode\u003eAWSTranscribeSTTService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new frames \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessorPauseFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessorResumeFrame\u003c/code\u003e\nwhich allow pausing and resuming frame processing for a given frame\nprocessor. These are control frames, so they are ordered. Pausing frame\nprocessor will keep old frames in the internal queues until resume takes\nplace. Frames being pushed while a frame processor is paused will be pushed to\nthe queues. When frame processing is resumed all queued frames will be\nprocessed in order. Also added \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessorPauseUrgentFrame\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessorResumeUrgentFrame\u003c/code\u003e which are system frames and therefore they\nhave high priority.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a property called \u003ccode\u003ehas_function_calls_in_progress\u003c/code\u003e in\n\u003ccode\u003eLLMAssistantContextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e that exposes whether a function call is in\nprogress.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eSambaNovaLLMService\u003c/code\u003e which provides llm api integration with an\nOpenAI-compatible interface.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eSambaNovaTTSService\u003c/code\u003e which provides speech-to-text functionality using\nSambaNovas's (whisper) API.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdd fundational examples for function calling and transcription\n\u003ccode\u003e14s-function-calling-sambanova.py\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eFunctionCallsStartedFrame\u003c/code\u003e. This frame is pushed both\nupstream and downstream from the LLM service to indicate that one or more\nfunction calls are going to be executed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded LLM services \u003ccode\u003eon_function_calls_started\u003c/code\u003e event. This event will be\ntriggered when the LLM service receives function calls from the model and is\ngoing to start executing them.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFunction calls can now be executed sequentially (in the order received in the\ncompletion) by passing \u003ccode\u003erun_in_parallel=False\u003c/code\u003e when creating your LLM\nservice. By default, if the LLM completion returns 2 or more function calls\nthey run concurrently. In both cases, concurrently and sequentially, a new LLM\ncompletion will run when the last function call finishes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded OpenTelemetry tracing for \u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eOpenAIRealtimeBetaLLMService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded initial support for interruption strategies, which determine if the user\nshould interrupt the bot while the bot is speaking. Interruption strategies\ncan be based on factors such as audio volume or the number of words spoken by\nthe user. These can be specified via the new \u003ccode\u003einterruption_strategies\u003c/code\u003e field\nin \u003ccode\u003ePipelineParams\u003c/code\u003e. A new \u003ccode\u003eMinWordsInterruptionStrategy\u003c/code\u003e strategy has been\nintroduced which triggers an interruption if the user has spoken a minimum\nnumber of words. If no interruption strategies are specified, the normal\ninterruption behavior applies. If multiple strategies are provided, the first\none that evaluates to true will trigger the interruption.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eBaseInputTransport\u003c/code\u003e now handles \u003ccode\u003eStopFrame\u003c/code\u003e. When a \u003ccode\u003eStopFrame\u003c/code\u003e is received\nthe transport will pause sending frames downstream until a new \u003ccode\u003eStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e is\nreceived. This allows the transport to be reused (keeping the same connection)\nin a different pipeline.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated AssemblyAI STT service to support their latest streaming\nspeech-to-text model with improved transcription latency and endpointing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can now access STT service results through the new\n\u003ccode\u003eTranscriptionFrame.result\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eInterimTranscriptionFrame.result\u003c/code\u003e field. This\nis useful in case you use some specific settings for the STT and you want to\naccess the STT results.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe examples runner is now public from the \u003ccode\u003epipecat.examples\u003c/code\u003e package. This\nallows everyone to build their own examples and run them easily.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIt is now possible to push \u003ccode\u003eOutputDTMFFrame\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eOutputDTMFUrgentFrame\u003c/code\u003e with\n\u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e. This will be sent properly if a Daily dial-out connection\nhas been established.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eOutputDTMFUrgentFrame\u003c/code\u003e to send a DTMF keypress quickly. The previous\n\u003ccode\u003eOutputDTMFFrame\u003c/code\u003e queues the keypress with the rest of data frames.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDTMFAggregator\u003c/code\u003e, which aggregates keypad presses into\n\u003ccode\u003eTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003es. Aggregation occurs after a timeout, termination key\npress, or user interruption. You can specify the prefix of the\n\u003ccode\u003eTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new functions \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport.start_transcription()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport.stop_transcription()\u003c/code\u003e to be able to start and stop Daily\ntranscription dynamically (maybe with different settings).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" model for \u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e back to\n\u003ccode\u003emodels/gemini-2.0-flash-live-001\u003c/code\u003e.\n\u003ccode\u003egemini-2.5-flash-preview-native-audio-dialog\u003c/code\u003e has inconsistent performance.\nYou can opt in to using this model by setting the \u003ccode\u003emodel\u003c/code\u003e arg.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFunction calls are now cancelled by default if there's an interruption. To\ndisable this behavior you can set \u003ccode\u003ecancel_on_interruption=False\u003c/code\u003e when\nregistering the function call. Since function calls are executed as tasks you\ncan tell if a function call has been cancelled by catching the\n\u003ccode\u003easyncio.CancelledError\u003c/code\u003e exception (and don't forget to raise it again!).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated OpenTelemetry tracing attribute \u003ccode\u003emetrics.ttfb_ms\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003emetrics.ttfb\u003c/code\u003e.\nThe attribute reports TTFB in seconds.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 issue with \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e where long responses would\ncontinue generating output even after an interruption.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue with the \u003ccode\u003eOpenAILLMContext\u003c/code\u003e where non-Roman characters were\nbeing incorrectly encoded as Unicode escape sequences. This was a logging\nissue and did not impact the actual conversation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIn \u003ccode\u003eAWSBedrockLLMService\u003c/code\u003e, worked around a possible bug in AWS Bedrock where\na \u003ccode\u003etoolConfig\u003c/code\u003e is required if there has been previous tool use in the\nmessages array. This workaround includes a no_op factory function call is\nused to satisfy the requirement.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed \u003ccode\u003eWebsocketClientTransport\u003c/code\u003e to use \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessorSetup.task_manager\u003c/code\u003e\ninstead of \u003ccode\u003eStartFrame.task_manager\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" \u003ccode\u003eGoogleHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e which uses Google's HTTP TTS API.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eTavusTransport\u003c/code\u003e, a new transport implementation compatible with any\nPipecat pipeline. When using the \u003ccode\u003eTavusTransport\u003c/code\u003ethe Pipecat bot will\nconnect in the same room as the Tavus Avatar and the user.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003ePlivoFrameSerializer\u003c/code\u003e to support Plivo calls. A full running example\nhas also been added to \u003ccode\u003eexamples/plivo-chatbot\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eUserBotLatencyLogObserver\u003c/code\u003e. This is an observer that logs the latency\nbetween when the user stops speaking and when the bot starts speaking. This\ngives you an initial idea on how quickly the AI services respond.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eSarvamTTSService\u003c/code\u003e, which implements Sarvam AI's TTS API:\n\u003ca href=\"https://docs.sarvam.ai/api-reference-docs/text-to-speech/convert\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://docs.sarvam.ai/api-reference-docs/text-to-speech/convert\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask.add_observer()\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask.remove_observer()\u003c/code\u003e to\nallow mangaging observers at runtime. This is useful for cases where the task\nis passed around to other code components that might want to observe the\npipeline dynamically.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003euser_id\u003c/code\u003e field to \u003ccode\u003eTranscriptionMessage\u003c/code\u003e. This allows identifying the\nuser in a multi-user scenario. Note that this requires that\n\u003ccode\u003eTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e has the \u003ccode\u003euser_id\u003c/code\u003e properly set.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e event handlers \u003ccode\u003eon_pipeline_started\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eon_pipeline_stopped\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eon_pipeline_ended\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eon_pipeline_cancelled\u003c/code\u003e, which\ncorrespond to the \u003ccode\u003eStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eStopFrame\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e\nrespectively.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded additional languages to \u003ccode\u003eLmntTTSService\u003c/code\u003e. Languages include: \u003ccode\u003ehi\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003eid\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eit\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eja\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003enl\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003epl\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eru\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003esv\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eth\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003etr\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003euk\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003evi\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a \u003ccode\u003emodel\u003c/code\u003e parameter to the \u003ccode\u003eLmntTTSService\u003c/code\u003e constructor, allowing\nswitching between LMNT models.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eMiniMaxHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e, which implements MiniMax's T2A API for TTS.\nLearn more: \u003ca href=\"https://www.minimax.io/platform_overview\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.minimax.io/platform_overview\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eA new function \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.setup()\u003c/code\u003e has been added to allow setting up\nframe processors before receiving a \u003ccode\u003eStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e. This is what's happening\ninternally: \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.setup()\u003c/code\u003e is called, \u003ccode\u003eStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e is pushed from\nthe beginning of the pipeline, your regular pipeline operations, \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e\nor \u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e are pushed from the beginning of the pipeline and finally\n\u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.cleanup()\u003c/code\u003e is called.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for OpenTelemetry tracing in Pipecat. This initial\nimplementation includes:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eA \u003ccode\u003esetup_tracing\u003c/code\u003e method where you can specify your OpenTelemetry exporter\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eService decorators for STT (\u003ccode\u003e@traced_stt\u003c/code\u003e), LLM (\u003ccode\u003e@traced_llm\u003c/code\u003e), and TTS\n(\u003ccode\u003e@traced_tts\u003c/code\u003e) which trace the execution and collect properties and\nmetrics (TTFB, token usage, character counts, etc.)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eClass decorators that provide execution tracking; these are generic and can\nbe used for service tracking as needed\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSpans that help track traces on a per conversations and turn basis:\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"conversation-uuid\n├── turn-1\n│   ├── stt_deepgramsttservice\n│   ├── llm_openaillmservice\n│   └── tts_cartesiattsservice\n...\n└── turn-n\n    └── ...\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003econversation-uuid\n├── turn-1\n│   ├── stt_deepgramsttservice\n│   ├── llm_openaillmservice\n│   └── tts_cartesiattsservice\n...\n└── turn-n\n    └── ...\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBy default, Pipecat has implemented service decorators to trace execution of\nSTT, LLM, and TTS services. You can enable tracing by setting\n\u003ccode\u003eenable_tracing\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eTrue\u003c/code\u003e in the PipelineTask.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eTurnTrackingObserver\u003c/code\u003e, which tracks the start and end of a user/bot\nturn pair and emits events \u003ccode\u003eon_turn_started\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eon_turn_stopped\u003c/code\u003e\ncorresponding to the start and end of a turn, respectively.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAllow passing observers to \u003ccode\u003erun_test()\u003c/code\u003e while running unit tests.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cg-emoji class=\"g-emoji\" alias=\"warning\"\u003e⚠️\u003c/g-emoji\u003e Updated \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e to align with how other transports handle\n\u003ccode\u003eon_client_disconnected\u003c/code\u003e. Now, when the connection is closed and no reconnection\nis attempted, \u003ccode\u003eon_client_disconnected\u003c/code\u003e is called instead of \u003ccode\u003eon_client_close\u003c/code\u003e. The\n\u003ccode\u003eon_client_close\u003c/code\u003e callback is no longer used, use \u003ccode\u003eon_client_disconnected\u003c/code\u003e instead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eCheck if \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e has already been cancelled.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eDon't raise an exception if event handler is not registered.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpgraded \u003ccode\u003edeepgram-sdk\u003c/code\u003e to 4.1.0.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eGoogleTTSService\u003c/code\u003e to use Google's streaming TTS API. The default\nvoice also updated to \u003ccode\u003een-US-Chirp3-HD-Charon\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cg-emoji class=\"g-emoji\" alias=\"warning\"\u003e⚠️\u003c/g-emoji\u003e Refactored the \u003ccode\u003eTavusVideoService\u003c/code\u003e, so it acts like a proxy, sending audio\nto Tavus and receiving both audio and video. This will make\n\u003ccode\u003eTavusVideoService\u003c/code\u003e usable with any Pipecat pipeline and with any transport.\nThis is a \u003cstrong\u003ebreaking change\u003c/strong\u003e, check the\n\u003ccode\u003eexamples/foundational/21a-tavus-layer-small-webrtc.py\u003c/code\u003e to see how to use it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e now uses custom microphone audio tracks instead of virtual\nmicrophones. Now, multiple Daily transports can be used in the same process.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e now captures audio from individual participants instead of\nthe whole room. This allows identifying audio frames per participant.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated the default model for \u003ccode\u003eAnthropicLLMService\u003c/code\u003e to\n\u003ccode\u003eclaude-sonnet-4-20250514\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated the default model for \u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e to\n\u003ccode\u003emodels/gemini-2.5-flash-preview-native-audio-dialog\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eBaseTextFilter\u003c/code\u003e methods \u003ccode\u003efilter()\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eupdate_settings()\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003ehandle_interruption()\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003ereset_interruption()\u003c/code\u003e are now async.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eBaseTextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e methods \u003ccode\u003eaggregate()\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ehandle_interruption()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003ereset()\u003c/code\u003e are now async.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe API version for \u003ccode\u003eCartesiaTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eCartesiaHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e has\nbeen updated. Also, the \u003ccode\u003ecartesia\u003c/code\u003e dependency has been updated to 2.x.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eCartesiaTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eCartesiaHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e now support Cartesia's new\n\u003ccode\u003espeed\u003c/code\u003e \u003ccode\u003efast\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e now uses the user transcription and usage\nmetrics provided by Gemini Live.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGoogleLLMService\u003c/code\u003e has been updated \u003ccode\u003ephonemize_between_brackets\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for cross-platform local smart turn detection. You can use\n\u003ccode\u003eLocalSmartTurnAnalyzer\u003c/code\u003e for on-device inference using Torch.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eBaseOutputTransport\u003c/code\u003e now allows multiple destinations if the transport\nimplementation supports it (e.g. Daily's custom tracks). With multiple\ndestinations it is possible to send different audio or video tracks with a\nsingle transport simultaneously. To do that, you need to set the new\n\u003ccode\u003eFrame.transport_destination\u003c/code\u003e field with your desired transport destination\n(e.g. custom track name), tell the transport you want a new destination with\n\u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.audio_out_destinations\u003c/code\u003e or\n\u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.video_out_destinations\u003c/code\u003e and the transport should take care of\nthe rest.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSimilar to the new \u003ccode\u003eFrame.transport_destination\u003c/code\u003e, there's a new\n\u003ccode\u003eFrame.transport_source\u003c/code\u003e field which is set by the \u003ccode\u003eBaseInputTransport\u003c/code\u003e if the\nincoming data comes from a non-default source (e.g. custom tracks).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTTSService\u003c/code\u003e has a new \u003ccode\u003etransport_destination\u003c/code\u003e constructor parameter. This\nparameter will be used to update the \u003ccode\u003eFrame.transport_destination\u003c/code\u003e field for\neach generated \u003ccode\u003eTTSAudioRawFrame\u003c/code\u003e. This allows sending multiple bots' audio to\nmultiple destinations in the same pipeline.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransportParams.camera_out_enabled\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eDailyTransportParams.microphone_out_enabled\u003c/code\u003e which allows you to\nenable/disable the main output camera or microphone tracks. This is useful if\nyou only want to use custom tracks and not send the main tracks. Note that you\nstill need \u003ccode\u003eaudio_out_enabled=True\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003evideo_out_enabled\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport.capture_participant_audio()\u003c/code\u003e which allows you to capture\nan audio source (e.g. \"microphone\", \"screenAudio\" or a custom track name) from\na remote participant.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport.update_publishing()\u003c/code\u003e which allows you to update the call\nvideo and audio publishing settings (e.g. audio and video quality).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eRTVIObserverParams\u003c/code\u003e which allows you to configure what RTVI messages\nare sent to the clients.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a \u003ccode\u003econtext_window_compression\u003c/code\u003e InputParam to\n\u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e which allows you to enable a sliding context\nwindow for the session as well as set the token limit of the sliding window.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCConnection\u003c/code\u003e to support \u003ccode\u003eice_servers\u003c/code\u003e with credentials.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eVADUserStartedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eVADUserStoppedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e,\nindicating when the VAD detected the user to start and stop speaking. These\nevents are helpful when using smart turn detection, as the user's stop time\ncan differ from when their turn ends (signified by UserStoppedSpeakingFrame).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eTranslationFrame\u003c/code\u003e, a new frame type that contains a translated\ntranscription.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.audio_in_passthrough\u003c/code\u003e. If set (the default), incoming\naudio will be pushed downstream.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eMCPClient\u003c/code\u003e; a way to connect to MCP servers and use the MCP servers'\ntools.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eMem0 OSS\u003c/code\u003e, along with Mem0 cloud support now the OSS version is also\navailable.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eChanged\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-changed-29\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Changed\" href=\"#changed-29\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.audio_mixer\u003c/code\u003e now supports a string and also a dictionary to\nprovide a mixer per destination. For example:\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"  audio_out_mixer={\n      \u0026quot;track-1\u0026quot;: SoundfileMixer(...),\n      \u0026quot;track-2\u0026quot;: SoundfileMixer(...),\n      \u0026quot;track-N\u0026quot;: SoundfileMixer(...),\n  },\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e  \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eaudio_out_mixer\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e{\n      \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"track-1\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eSoundfileMixer\u003c/span\u003e(...),\n      \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"track-2\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eSoundfileMixer\u003c/span\u003e(...),\n      \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"track-N\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eSoundfileMixer\u003c/span\u003e(...),\n  },\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eSTTMuteFilter\u003c/code\u003e now mutes \u003ccode\u003eInterimTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eTranscriptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e which allows the \u003ccode\u003eSTTMuteFilter\u003c/code\u003e to be used in\nconjunction with transports that generate transcripts, e.g. \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFunction calls now receive a single parameter \u003ccode\u003eFunctionCallParams\u003c/code\u003e instead of\n\u003ccode\u003e(function_name, tool_call_id, args, llm, context, result_callback)\u003c/code\u003e which is\nnow deprecated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eChanged the user aggregator timeout for late transcriptions from 1.0s to 0.5s\n(\u003ccode\u003eLLMUserAggregatorParams.aggregation_timeout\u003c/code\u003e). Sometimes, the STT services\nmight give us more than one transcription which could come after the user\nstopped speaking. We still want to include these additional transcriptions\nwith the first one because it's part of the user turn. This is what this\ntimeout is helpful with.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eShort utterances not detected by VAD while the bot is speaking are now\nignored. This reduces the amount of bot interruptions significantly providing\na more natural conversation experience.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eGladiaSTTService\u003c/code\u003e to output a \u003ccode\u003eTranslationFrame\u003c/code\u003e when specifying a\n\u003ccode\u003etranslation\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003etranslation_config\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSTT services now passthrough audio frames by default. This allows you to add\naudio recording without worrying about what's wrong in your pipeline when it\ndoesn't work the first time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eInput transports now always push audio downstream unless disabled with\n\u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.audio_in_passthrough\u003c/code\u003e. After many Pipecat releases, we\nrealized this is the common use case. There are use cases where the input\ntransport already provides STT and you also don't want recordings, in which\ncase there's no need to push audio to the rest of the pipeline, but this is\nnot a very common case.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eRivaSegmentedSTTService\u003c/code\u003e, which allows Riva offline/batch models, such\nas to be \"canary-1b-asr\" used in Pipecat.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" are\ndeprectated, use a single \u003ccode\u003eFunctionCallParams\u003c/code\u003e parameter instead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.camera_*\u003c/code\u003e parameters are now deprecated, use\n\u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.video_*\u003c/code\u003e instead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.vad_enabled\u003c/code\u003e parameter is now deprecated, use\n\u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.audio_in_enabled\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.vad_analyzer\u003c/code\u003e instead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.vad_audio_passthrough\u003c/code\u003e parameter is now deprecated, use\n\u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.audio_in_passthrough\u003c/code\u003e instead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eParakeetSTTService\u003c/code\u003e is now deprecated, use \u003ccode\u003eRivaSTTService\u003c/code\u003e instead, which uses\nthe model \"parakeet-ctc-1.1b-asr\" by default.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eFastPitchTTSService\u003c/code\u003e is now deprecated, use \u003ccode\u003eRivaTTSService\u003c/code\u003e instead, which uses\nthe model \"magpie-tts-multilingual\" by default.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv \u003ccode\u003eSimliVideoService\u003c/code\u003e where the bot was continuously outputting\naudio, which prevents the \u003ccode\u003eBotStoppedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e from being emitted.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where \u003ccode\u003eOpenAIRealtimeBetaLLMService\u003c/code\u003e would add two assistant\nmessages to the context.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue with \u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e where the context\ncontained tokens instead of words.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue with HTTP Smart Turn handling, where the service returns a 500\nerror. Previously, this would cause an unhandled exception. Now, a 500 error\nis treated as an incomplete response.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a TTS services issue that could cause assistant output not to \u003ccode\u003eSmartTurnMetricsData\u003c/code\u003e was reporting 0ms for\ninference and processing time when using the \u003ccode\u003eFalSmartTurnAnalyzer\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" serializer. This feature hangs up\nthe Twilio call when an \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e is received. It is\nenabled by default and is configurable via the \u003ccode\u003eauto_hang_up\u003c/code\u003e \u003ccode\u003eInputParam\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eSmartTurnMetricsData\u003c/code\u003e, which contains end-of-turn prediction metrics,\nto the \u003ccode\u003eMetricsFrame\u003c/code\u003e. Using \u003ccode\u003eMetricsFrame\u003c/code\u003e, you can now retrieve prediction\nconfidence scores and processing time metrics from the smart turn analyzers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for Application Default Credentials in Google services,\n\u003ccode\u003eGoogleSTTService\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eGoogleTTSService\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003eGoogleVertexLLMService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for Smart Turn Detection via the \u003ccode\u003eturn_analyzer\u003c/code\u003e transport\nparameter. You can now choose between \u003ccode\u003eHttpSmartTurnAnalyzer()\u003c/code\u003e or\n\u003ccode\u003eFalSmartTurnAnalyzer()\u003c/code\u003e for remote inference or\n\u003ccode\u003eLocalCoreMLSmartTurnAnalyzer()\u003c/code\u003e for on-device inference using Core ML.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDeepgramTTSService\u003c/code\u003e accepts \u003ccode\u003ebase_url\u003c/code\u003e argument again, allowing you to\nconnect to an on-prem service.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eLLMUserAggregatorParams\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eLLMAssistantAggregatorParams\u003c/code\u003e which allow\nyou to control aggregator settings. You can now pass these arguments when\ncreating aggregator pairs with \u003ccode\u003ecreate_context_aggregator()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eprevious_text\u003c/code\u003e context support to ElevenLabsHttpTTSService, improving\nspeech consistency across sentences within an LLM response.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded word/timestamp pairs to \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIt is now possible to disable \u003ccode\u003eSoundfileMixer\u003c/code\u003e when created. You can then use\n\u003ccode\u003eMixerEnableFrame\u003c/code\u003e to dynamically enable it when necessary.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eon_client_connected\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eon_client_disconnected\u003c/code\u003e event handlers to\nthe \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e class. These handlers map to the same underlying Daily\nevents as \u003ccode\u003eon_participant_joined\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eon_participant_left\u003c/code\u003e, respectively.\nThis makes it easier to write a single bot pipeline that can also use other\ntransports like \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eFastAPIWebsocketTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eChanged\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-changed-31\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Changed\" href=\"#changed-31\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGrokLLMService\u003c/code\u003e now uses \u003ccode\u003egrok-3-beta\u003c/code\u003e as its default model.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eDaily's REST helpers now include an \u003ccode\u003eeject_at_token_exp\u003c/code\u003e param, which ejects\nthe user when their token expires. This new parameter defaults to False.\nAlso, the default value for \u003ccode\u003eenable_prejoin_ui\u003c/code\u003e changed to False and\n\u003ccode\u003eeject_at_room_exp\u003c/code\u003e changed to False.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eOpenAILLMService\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eOpenPipeLLMService\u003c/code\u003e now use
