resolution control to \u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e with\n\u003ccode\u003eGeminiMediaResolution\u003c/code\u003e enum, allowing configuration of token usage for\nimage processing (LOW: 64 tokens, MEDIUM: 256 tokens, HIGH: zoomed reframing\nwith 256 tokens).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded Gemini's Voice Activity Detection (VAD) configuration to\n\u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e with \u003ccode\u003eGeminiVADParams\u003c/code\u003e, allowing fine\ncontrol over speech detection sensitivity and timing, including:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eStart sensitivity (how quickly speech is detected)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnd sensitivity (how quickly turns end after pauses)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePrefix padding (milliseconds of audio to keep before speech is detected)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSilence duration (milliseconds of silence required to end a turn)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded comprehensive language support to \u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e,\nsupporting over 30 languages via the \u003ccode\u003elanguage\u003c/code\u003e parameter, with proper\nmapping between Pipecat's \u003ccode\u003eLanguage\u003c/code\u003e enum and Gemini's language codes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support in \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e to detect when remote tracks are\nmuted.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for image capture from a video stream to the\n\u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a new iOS client option to the \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cstrong\u003evideo-transform\u003c/strong\u003e example.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new processors \u003ccode\u003eProducerProcessor\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eConsumerProcessor\u003c/code\u003e. The\nproducer processor processes frames from the pipeline and decides whether the\nconsumers should consume it or not. If so, the same frame that is received by\nthe producer is sent to the consumer. There can be multiple consumers per\nproducer. These processors can be useful to push frames from one part of a\npipeline to a different one (e.g. when using \u003ccode\u003eParallelPipeline\u003c/code\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eImprovements for the \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWait until the pipeline is ready before triggering the \u003ccode\u003econnected\u003c/code\u003e event.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eQueue messages if the data channel is not ready.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate the aiortc dependency to fix an issue where the 'video/rtx' MIME\ntype was incorrectly handled as a codec retransmission.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAvoid initial video delays.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" Mem0 is a self-improving memory layer for LLM\napplications. Learn more at: \u003ca href=\"https://mem0.ai/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://mem0.ai/\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eWhisperSTTServiceMLX\u003c/code\u003e for Whisper transcription on Apple Silicon.\nSee example in \u003ccode\u003eexamples/foundational/13e-whisper-mlx.py\u003c/code\u003e. Latency of\ncompleted transcription using Whisper large-v3-turbo on an M4 macbook is\n~500ms.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e, a new P2P WebRTC transport.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCreated two examples in \u003ccode\u003ep2p-webrtc\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003evideo-transform\u003c/strong\u003e: Demonstrates sending and receiving audio/video with\n\u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e using \u003ccode\u003eTypeScript\u003c/code\u003e. Includes video frame\nprocessing with OpenCV.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003evoice-agent\u003c/strong\u003e: A minimal example of creating a voice agent with\n\u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGladiaSTTService\u003c/code\u003e now have comprehensive support for the latest API config\noptions, including model, language detection, preprocessing, custom\nvocabulary, custom spelling, translation, and message filtering options.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e, a new P2P WebRTC transport.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCreated two examples in \u003ccode\u003ep2p-webrtc\u003c/code\u003e:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003evideo-transform\u003c/strong\u003e: Demonstrates sending and receiving audio/video with\n\u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e using \u003ccode\u003eTypeScript\u003c/code\u003e. Includes video frame\nprocessing with OpenCV.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003evoice-agent\u003c/strong\u003e: A minimal example of creating a voice agent with\n\u003ccode\u003eSmallWebRTCTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support Each package can have\none or more of the following modules (in the future new module names might be\nneeded) depending on the services implemented:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eimage: for image generation services\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ellm: for LLM services\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ememory: for memory services\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003estt: for Speech-To-Text services\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003etts: for Text-To-Speech services\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003evideo: for video generation services\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003evision: for video recognition services\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBase classes for AI services have been reorganized into modules. They can now\nbe found in\n\u003ccode\u003epipecat.services.[ai_service,image_service,llm_service,stt_service,vision_service]\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGladiaSTTService\u003c/code\u003e now uses the \u003ccode\u003esolaria-1\u003c/code\u003e model by default. Other params\nuse Gladia's default values. function call it is now possible to indicate if you want\nthe function call to be cancelled if there's a user interruption via\n\u003ccode\u003ecancel_on_interruption\u003c/code\u003e (defaults to False). This is now possible because\nfunction calls are executed concurrently.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for detecting idle pipelines. By default, if no activity has\nbeen detected during 5 minutes, the \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e will be automatically\ncancelled. It is possible to override this behavior by passing\n\u003ccode\u003ecancel_on_idle_timeout=False\u003c/code\u003e. It is also possible to change the default\ntimeout with \u003ccode\u003eidle_timeout_secs\u003c/code\u003e or the frames that prevent the pipeline from\nbeing idle with \u003ccode\u003eidle_timeout_frames\u003c/code\u003e. Finally, an \u003ccode\u003eon_idle_timeout\u003c/code\u003e event\nhandler will be triggered if the idle timeout is reached (whether the pipeline\ntask is cancelled or not).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eFalSTTService\u003c/code\u003e, which provides STT for Fal's Wizper API.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a \u003ccode\u003ereconnect_on_error\u003c/code\u003e parameter to websocket-based TTS services as well\nas a \u003ccode\u003eon_connection_error\u003c/code\u003e event handler. The \u003ccode\u003ereconnect_on_error\u003c/code\u003e indicates\nwhether the TTS service should reconnect on error. The \u003ccode\u003eon_connection_error\u003c/code\u003e\nwill always get called if there's any error no matter the value of\n\u003ccode\u003ereconnect_on_error\u003c/code\u003e. This allows, for example, to fallback to a different TTS\nprovider if something goes wrong with the current one.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eSkipTagsAggregator\u003c/code\u003e that extends \u003ccode\u003eBaseTextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e to aggregate\ntext and skips end of sentence matching if aggregated text is between\nstart/end tags.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003ePatternPairAggregator\u003c/code\u003e that extends \u003ccode\u003eBaseTextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e to\nidentify content between matching pattern pairs in streamed text. This allows\nfor detection and processing of structured content like XML-style tags that\nmay span across multiple text chunks or sentence boundaries.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eBaseTextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e. Text aggregators are used by the TTS service\nto aggregate LLM tokens and decide when the aggregated text should be pushed\nto the TTS service. They also allow for the text to be manipulated while it's\nbeing aggregated. A text aggregator can be passed via \u003ccode\u003etext_aggregator\u003c/code\u003e to the\nTTS service.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003esample_rate\u003c/code\u003e constructor parameter to \u003ccode\u003eTavusVideoService\u003c/code\u003e to allow\nchanging the output sample rate.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eNeuphonicTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\n(see \u003ca href=\"https://neuphonic.com\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://neuphonic.com\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eUltravoxSTTService\u003c/code\u003e.\n(see \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/fixie-ai/ultravox\"\u003ehttps://github.com/fixie-ai/ultravox\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eon_frame_reached_upstream\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eon_frame_reached_downstream\u003c/code\u003e event\nhandlers to \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e. Those events will be called when a frame reaches\nthe beginning or end of the pipeline respectively. Note that by default, the\nevent handlers will not be called unless a filter is set with\n\u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask.set_reached_upstream_filter()\u003c/code\u003e or\n\u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask.set_reached_downstream_filter()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for Chirp voices in \u003ccode\u003eGoogleTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a \u003ccode\u003eflush_audio()\u003c/code\u003e method to \u003ccode\u003eFishTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eLmntTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a \u003ccode\u003eset_language\u003c/code\u003e convenience method for \u003ccode\u003eGoogleSTTService\u003c/code\u003e, allowing\nyou to set a single language. This is in addition to the \u003ccode\u003eset_languages\u003c/code\u003e\nmethod which allows you to set a list of languages.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eon_user_turn_audio_data\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eon_bot_turn_audio_data\u003c/code\u003e to\n\u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e. This gives the ability to grab the audio of only that\nturn for both the user and the bot.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new base class \u003ccode\u003eBaseObject\u003c/code\u003e which is now the base class of\n\u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ePipelineRunner\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eBaseTransport\u003c/code\u003e. The\nnew \u003ccode\u003eBaseObject\u003c/code\u003e adds supports for event handlers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for a unified format for specifying function calling across all\nLLM services.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"  weather_function = FunctionSchema(\n      name=\u0026quot;get_current_weather\u0026quot;,\n      description=\u0026quot;Get the current weather\u0026quot;,\n      properties={\n          \u0026quot;location\u0026quot;: {\n              \u0026quot;type\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;string\u0026quot;,\n              \u0026quot;description\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;The city and state, e.g. San Francisco, CA\u0026quot;,\n          },\n          \u0026quot;format\u0026quot;: {\n              \u0026quot;type\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;string\u0026quot;,\n              \u0026quot;enum\u0026quot;: [\u0026quot;celsius\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;fahrenheit\u0026quot;],\n              \u0026quot;description\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;The temperature unit to use. Infer this from the user's location.\u0026quot;,\n          },\n      },\n      required=[\u0026quot;location\u0026quot;],\n  )\n  tools = ToolsSchema(standard_tools=[weather_function])\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e  \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eweather_function\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eFunctionSchema\u003c/span\u003e(\n      \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003ename\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"get_current_weather\"\u003c/span\u003e,\n      \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003edescription\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"Get the current weather\"\u003c/span\u003e,\n      \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eproperties\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e{\n          \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"location\"\u003c/span\u003e: {\n              \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"type\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"string\"\u003c/span\u003e,\n              \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"description\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"The city and state, e.g. San Francisco, CA\"\u003c/span\u003e,\n          },\n          \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"format\"\u003c/span\u003e: {\n              \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"type\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"string\"\u003c/span\u003e,\n              \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"enum\"\u003c/span\u003e: [\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"celsius\"\u003c/span\u003e, \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"fahrenheit\"\u003c/span\u003e],\n              \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"description\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"The temperature unit to use. The values are\npassed as a mapping that will then be converted to arguments.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003espeed\u003c/code\u003e as an \u003ccode\u003eInputParam\u003c/code\u003e for both \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eLLMFullResponseAggregator\u003c/code\u003e to aggregate full LLM completions. assistant aggregator issue that could cause assistant text to be\nsplit into multiple chunks during function calls.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an assistant aggregator issue that was causing assistant text to not be\nadded to the context during function calls. This could lead to duplications.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eSegmentedSTTService\u003c/code\u003e issue that was causing audio to be sent\nprematurely to the STT service. Instead of analyzing the volume in this\nservice we rely on VAD events which use both VAD and volume.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e issue that was causing messages to be\nduplicated in the context when pushing \u003ccode\u003eLLMMessagesAppendFrame\u003c/code\u003e frames.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue with \u003ccode\u003eSegmentedSTTService\u003c/code\u003e based services\n(e.g. \u003ccode\u003eGroqSTTService\u003c/code\u003e) that was not allow audio to pass-through downstream.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eCartesiaTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eRimeTTSService\u003c/code\u003e issue that would consider\ntext between spelling out tags end of sentence.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003ematch_endofsentence\u003c/code\u003e issue that would result in floating point\nnumbers to be considered an end of sentence.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003ematch_endofsentence\u003c/code\u003e issue that would result in emails to be\nconsidered an end of sentence.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where the RTVI message \u003ccode\u003edisconnect-bot\u003c/code\u003e was pushing an\n\u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e, resulting in the pipeline not shutting down. It now pushes an\n\u003ccode\u003eEndTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e upstream to shutdown the pipeline.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue with the \u003ccode\u003eGoogleSTTService\u003c/code\u003e where stream timeouts during\nperiods of inactivity were causing connection failures. The service now\nproperly detects timeout errors and handles reconnection gracefully,\nensuring continuous operation even after periods of silence or when using an\n\u003ccode\u003eSTTMuteFilter\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eRimeTTSService\u003c/code\u003e where the last line of text sent didn't\nresult in an audio output being generated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed \u003ccode\u003eOpenAIRealtimeBetaLLMService\u003c/code\u003e by adding proper handling for:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003econversation.item.input_audio_transcription.delta\u003c/code\u003e server message,\nwhich was added server-side at some point and not handled audio event \u003ccode\u003eon_track_audio_data\u003c/code\u003e to\n\u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e for accessing separate input and output audio tracks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003ePipecat version will now be logged on every application startup. This will\nhelp us identify what version we are running in case of any issues.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a new \u003ccode\u003eStopFrame\u003c/code\u003e which can be used to stop a pipeline task while\nkeeping the frame processors running. The frame processors could then be used\nin a different pipeline. The difference between a \u003ccode\u003eStopFrame\u003c/code\u003e and a\n\u003ccode\u003eStopTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e is that, as with \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eEndTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e, the\n\u003ccode\u003eStopFrame\u003c/code\u003e is pushed from the task and the \u003ccode\u003eStopTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e is pushed upstream\ninside the pipeline by any processor.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a new \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e parameter \u003ccode\u003eobservers\u003c/code\u003e that replaces the previous\n\u003ccode\u003ePipelineParams.observers\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a new \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e parameter \u003ccode\u003echeck_dangling_tasks\u003c/code\u003e to enable or\ndisable checking for frame processors' dangling tasks when the Pipeline\nfinishes running.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eon_completion_timeout\u003c/code\u003e event for LLM services (all OpenAI-based\nservices, Anthropic and Google). Note that this event will only get triggered\nif LLM timeouts are setup and if the timeout was reached. It can be useful to\nretrigger another completion and see if the timeout was just a blip.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new log observers \u003ccode\u003eLLMLogObserver\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eTranscriptionLogObserver\u003c/code\u003e that\ncan be useful for debugging your pipelines.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eroom_url\u003c/code\u003e property to \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eaddons\u003c/code\u003e argument to \u003ccode\u003eDeepgramSTTService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eexponential_backoff_time()\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eutils.network\u003c/code\u003e module.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" \u003ccode\u003evoice_engine\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eprotocol\u003c/code\u003e input\nin the constructor. The previous method of providing a \u003ccode\u003evoice_engine\u003c/code\u003e input\nthat contains the engine and protocol is deprecated by PlayHT.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe base \u003ccode\u003eTTSService\u003c/code\u003e class now strips leading newlines before sending text\nto the TTS provider. This change is to solve issues where some TTS providers,\nlike Azure, would not output text due to newlines.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGrokLLMSService\u003c/code\u003e now uses \u003ccode\u003egrok-2\u003c/code\u003e as the default model.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eAnthropicLLMService\u003c/code\u003e now uses \u003ccode\u003eclaude-3-7-sonnet-20250219\u003c/code\u003e as the default\nmodel.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eRimeHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e needs an \u003ccode\u003eaiohttp.ClientSession\u003c/code\u003e to be passed to the\nconstructor as all the other HTTP-based services.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eRimeHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e doesn't use a default voice anymore.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDeepgramSTTService\u003c/code\u003e now uses the new \u003ccode\u003enova-3\u003c/code\u003e model by default. If you want\nto use the previous model you can pass \u003ccode\u003eLiveOptions(model=\"nova-2-general\")\u003c/code\u003e.\n(see \u003ca href=\"https://deepgram.com/learn/introducing-nova-3-speech-to-text-api\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://deepgram.com/learn/introducing-nova-3-speech-to-text-api\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight \u003ccode\u003eDeepgramSTTService\u003c/code\u003e where the \u003ccode\u003esample_rate\u003c/code\u003e passed to the\n\u003ccode\u003eLiveOptions\u003c/code\u003e was not being used, causing the \u003ccode\u003eAudioContextWordTTSService\u003c/code\u003e. This is a TTS base class for TTS\nservices that handling multiple separate audio requests.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new frames \u003ccode\u003eEmulateUserStartedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eEmulateUserStoppedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e which can be used to emulated VAD behavior\nwithout VAD being present or not being triggered.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a new \u003ccode\u003eaudio_in_stream_on_start\u003c/code\u003e field to \u003ccode\u003eTransportParams\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a new method \u003ccode\u003estart_audio_in_streaming\u003c/code\u003e in the \u003ccode\u003eBaseInputTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis method should be used to start receiving the input audio in case the\nfield \u003ccode\u003eaudio_in_stream_on_start\u003c/code\u003e is set to \u003ccode\u003efalse\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for the \u003ccode\u003eRTVIProcessor\u003c/code\u003e to handle buffered audio in \u003ccode\u003ebase64\u003c/code\u003e\nformat, converting it into InputAudioRawFrame for transport.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for the \u003ccode\u003eRTVIProcessor\u003c/code\u003e to trigger \u003ccode\u003estart_audio_in_streaming\u003c/code\u003e\nonly after the \u003ccode\u003eclient-ready\u003c/code\u003e message.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eMUTE_UNTIL_FIRST_BOT_COMPLETE\u003c/code\u003e strategy to \u003ccode\u003eSTTMuteStrategy\u003c/code\u003e. This\nstrategy starts muted and remains muted until the first bot speech completes,\nensuring the bot's first response cannot be interrupted. This complements the\nexisting \u003ccode\u003eFIRST_SPEECH\u003c/code\u003e strategy which only mutes during the first detected\nbot speech.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for Google Cloud Speech-to-Text V2 through \u003ccode\u003eGoogleSTTService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eRimeTTSService\u003c/code\u003e, a new \u003ccode\u003eWordTTSService\u003c/code\u003e. Updated the foundational\nexample \u003ccode\u003e07q-interruptible-rime.py\u003c/code\u003e to use \u003ccode\u003eRimeTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded support for Groq's Whisper API through the new \u003ccode\u003eGroqSTTService\u003c/code\u003e and\nOpenAI's Whisper API through the new \u003ccode\u003eOpenAISTTService\u003c/code\u003e. Introduced a new\nbase class \u003ccode\u003eBaseWhisperSTTService\u003c/code\u003e to handle common Whisper API\nfunctionality.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003ePerplexityLLMService\u003c/code\u003e for Perplexity NIM API integration, with an\nOpenAI-compatible interface. Also, added foundational example\n\u003ccode\u003e14n-function-calling-perplexity.py\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport.update_remote_participants()\u003c/code\u003e. This allows you to update\nremote participant's settings, like their permissions or which of their\ndevices are enabled. Requires that the local participant have participant\nadmin permission.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eWe don't consider a colon \u003ccode\u003e:\u003c/code\u003e and end of sentence any more.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e to respect the \u003ccode\u003eaudio_in_stream_on_start\u003c/code\u003e field,\nensuring it only starts receiving the audio input if it is enabled.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eFastAPIWebsocketOutputTransport\u003c/code\u003e to send \u003ccode\u003eTransportMessageFrame\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eTransportMessageUrgentFrame\u003c/code\u003e to the serializer.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eWebsocketServerOutputTransport\u003c/code\u003e to send \u003ccode\u003eTransportMessageFrame\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eTransportMessageUrgentFrame\u003c/code\u003e to the serializer.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eEnhanced \u003ccode\u003eSTTMuteConfig\u003c/code\u003e to validate strategy combinations, preventing\n\u003ccode\u003eMUTE_UNTIL_FIRST_BOT_COMPLETE\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eFIRST_SPEECH\u003c/code\u003e from being used together\nas they handle first bot speech differently.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated foundational example \u003ccode\u003e07n-interruptible-google.py\u003c/code\u003e to use all Google\nservices.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eRimeHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e now uses the \u003ccode\u003emistv2\u003c/code\u003e model by default.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp model\ndocumentation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated foundation example \u003ccode\u003e14f-function-calling-groq.py\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eGroqLLMService\u003c/code\u003e to use \u003ccode\u003ellama-3.3-70b-versatile\u003c/code\u003e as the default\nmodel.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a websocket-based service issue (e.g. \u003ccode\u003eCartesiaTTSService\u003c/code\u003e) that was\npreventing a reconnection after the server disconnected cleanly, which was\ncausing an inifite loop instead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eBaseOutputTransport\u003c/code\u003e issue that was causing upstream frames to no be\npushed upstream.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed multiple issue where user transcriptions where not being handled\nproperly. It was possible for short utterances to not trigger VAD which would\ncause user transcriptions to be ignored. It was also possible for one or more\ntranscriptions to be generated after VAD in which case they would also be\nignored.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue that was causing \u003ccode\u003eBotStoppedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e to be generated too\nlate. This could then cause issues unblocking \u003ccode\u003eSTTMuteFilter\u003c/code\u003e later than\ndesired.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue that was causing \u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e to not record\nsynchronized audio.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an \u003ccode\u003eRTVI\u003c/code\u003e issue that was causing \u003ccode\u003ebot-tts-text\u003c/code\u003e messages to be sent\nbefore being processed by the output transport.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue[#1192] in 11labs where we are trying to reconnect/disconnect\nthe websocket connection even when the connection is already closed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where \u003ccode\u003ehas_regular_messages\u003c/code\u003e condition was always true in\n\u003ccode\u003eGoogleLLMContext\u003c/code\u003e due to \u003ccode\u003ePart\u003c/code\u003e having \u003ccode\u003efunction_call\u003c/code\u003e \u0026amp; \u003ccode\u003estart_metadata\u003c/code\u003e field to \u003ccode\u003ePipelineParams\u003c/code\u003e. The provided metadata\nwill be set to the initial \u003ccode\u003eStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e being pushed from the \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new fields to \u003ccode\u003ePipelineParams\u003c/code\u003e to control audio input and output sample\nrates for the whole pipeline. This allows controlling sample rates from a\nsingle place instead of having to specify sample rates in each\nservice. Setting a sample rate to a service is still possible and will\noverride the value from \u003ccode\u003ePipelineParams\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduce audio resamplers (\u003ccode\u003eBaseAudioResampler\u003c/code\u003e). This is just a base class\nto implement audio resamplers. Currently, two implementations are provided\n\u003ccode\u003eSOXRAudioResampler\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eResampyResampler\u003c/code\u003e. A new\n\u003ccode\u003ecreate_default_resampler()\u003c/code\u003e has been added (replacing the now deprecated\n\u003ccode\u003eresample_audio()\u003c/code\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIt is now possible to specify the asyncio event loop that a \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e and\nall the processors should run on by passing it as a new argument to the\n\u003ccode\u003ePipelineRunner\u003c/code\u003e. This could allow running pipelines in multiple threads each\none with its own event loop.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a new \u003ccode\u003eutils.TaskManager\u003c/code\u003e. Instead of a global task manager we now have\na task manager per \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e. In the previous version the task manager\nwas global, so running multiple simultaneous \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003es could result in\ndangling task warnings which were not actually true. In order, for all the\nprocessors to know about the task manager, we pass it through the\n\u003ccode\u003eStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e. This means that processors should create tasks when they receive\na \u003ccode\u003eStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e but not before (because they don't have a task manager yet).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eTelnyxFrameSerializer\u003c/code\u003e to support Telnyx calls. A full running example\nhas also been added to \u003ccode\u003eexamples/telnyx-chatbot\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAllow pushing silence audio frames before \u003ccode\u003eTTSStoppedFrame\u003c/code\u003e. This might be\nuseful for testing purposes, for example, passing bot audio to an STT service\nwhich usually needs additional audio data to detect the utterance stopped.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTwilioSerializer\u003c/code\u003e now supports transport message frames. With this we can\ncreate Twilio emulators.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a new transport: \u003ccode\u003eWebsocketClientTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a \u003ccode\u003emetadata\u003c/code\u003e field to \u003ccode\u003eFrame\u003c/code\u003e which makes it possible to pass custom\ndata to all frames.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003etest/utils.py\u003c/code\u003e inside of pipecat package.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eChanged\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-changed-39\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Changed\" href=\"#changed-39\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGatedOpenAILLMContextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e now require keyword arguments. Also, a new\n\u003ccode\u003estart_open\u003c/code\u003e argument has been added to set the initial state of the gate.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eorganization\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eproject\u003c/code\u003e level authentication to\n\u003ccode\u003eOpenAILLMService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eImproved the language checking logic in \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e to properly handle language codes based on model\ncompatibility, with appropriate warnings when language codes cannot be\napplied.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eGoogleLLMContext\u003c/code\u003e to support pushing \u003ccode\u003eLLMMessagesUpdateFrame\u003c/code\u003es that\ncontain a combination of function calls, function call responses, system\nmessages, or just messages.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eInputDTMFFrame\u003c/code\u003e is now based on \u003ccode\u003eDTMFFrame\u003c/code\u003e. There's also a new\n\u003ccode\u003eOutputDTMFFrame\u003c/code\u003e frame.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 \u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e that would cause crackling in some recordings.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e where user callback would not be\ncalled on task cancellation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e that would cause wrong silence\npadding in some cases.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e messages would return a 1009\nwebsocket error by increasing the max message size limit to 16MB.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e issue that would cause events to be triggered before\njoin finished.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e issue that was preventing processors to be cleaned up\nafter cancelling the task.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where queuing a \u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e to a pipeline task would not\ncause the task to finish. However, using \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask.cancel()\u003c/code\u003e is still the\nrecommended way to cancel a task.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eOther\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-other-17\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Other\" href=\"#other-17\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eImproved Unit Test \u003ccode\u003erun_test()\u003c/code\u003e to use \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003ePipelineRunner\u003c/code\u003e. There's now also some control around \u003ccode\u003eStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e. The \u003ccode\u003eEndTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e has been removed since it doesn't seem\nnecessary with this new approach.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003etwilio-chatbot\u003c/code\u003e with a few new features: use 8000 sample rate and\navoid resampling, a new client useful for stress testing and testing locally\nwithout the need to make phone calls. Also, added audio recording on both the\nclient and the server to make sure the audio sounds good.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated examples to use \u003ccode\u003etask.cancel()\u003c/code\u003e to immediately exit the example when a\nparticipant leaves or disconnects, instead of pushing an \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e. Pushing\nan \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e causes the bot to run through everything that is internally\nqueued (which could take some seconds). Note that using \u003ccode\u003etask.cancel()\u003c/code\u003e might\nnot always be the best option and pushing an \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e could still be\ndesirable to make sure all the pipeline is flushed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" processors it is now recommended to\nuse \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.create_task()\u003c/code\u003e (which uses the new\n\u003ccode\u003eutils.asyncio.create_task()\u003c/code\u003e). It takes care of uncaught exceptions, task\ncancellation handling and task management. To cancel or wait for a task there\nis \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.cancel_task()\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.wait_for_task()\u003c/code\u003e. All of\nPipecat processors have been updated accordingly. Also, when a pipeline runner\nfinishes, a warning about dangling tasks might appear, which indicates if any\nof the created tasks was never cancelled or awaited for (using these new\nfunctions).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIt is now possible to specify the period of the \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e heartbeat\nframes with \u003ccode\u003eheartbeats_period_secs\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDailyMeetingTokenProperties\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eDailyMeetingTokenParams\u003c/code\u003e Pydantic models\nfor meeting token creation in \u003ccode\u003eget_token\u003c/code\u003e method of \u003ccode\u003eDailyRESTHelper\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eenable_recording\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003egeo\u003c/code\u003e parameters to \u003ccode\u003eDailyRoomProperties\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eRecordingsBucketConfig\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003eDailyRoomProperties\u003c/code\u003e to upload recordings\nto a custom AWS bucket.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eEnhanced \u003ccode\u003eUserIdleProcessor\u003c/code\u003e with retry functionality and control over idle\nmonitoring via new callback signature \u003ccode\u003e(processor, retry_count) -\u0026gt; bool\u003c/code\u003e.\nUpdated the \u003ccode\u003e17-detect-user-idle.py\u003c/code\u003e to show how to use the \u003ccode\u003eretry_count\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdd defensive error handling for \u003ccode\u003eOpenAIRealtimeBetaLLMService\u003c/code\u003e's audio\ntruncation. Audio truncation errors during interruptions now log a warning\nand allow the session to continue instead of throwing an exception.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eModified \u003ccode\u003eTranscriptProcessor\u003c/code\u003e to use TTS text frames for more accurate assistant\ntranscripts. Assistant messages are now aggregated based on bot speaking boundaries\nrather than LLM context, providing better handling of interruptions and partial\nutterances.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated foundational examples \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e which uses EleveLabs' HTTP API instead of the\nwebsocket one.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduced pipeline frame observers. Observers can view all the frames that go\nthrough the pipeline without the need to inject processors in the\npipeline. This can be useful, for example, to implement frame loggers or\ndebuggers among other things. The example\n\u003ccode\u003eexamples/foundational/30-observer.py\u003c/code\u003e shows how to add an observer to a\npipeline for debugging.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduced heartbeat frames. The pipeline task can now push periodic\nheartbeats down the pipeline when \u003ccode\u003eenable_heartbeats=True\u003c/code\u003e. Heartbeats are\nsystem frames that are supposed to make it all the way to the end of the\npipeline. When a heartbeat frame is received the traversing time (i.e. the\ntime it took to go through the whole pipeline) will be displayed (with TRACE\nlogging) otherwise a warning will be shown. The example\n\u003ccode\u003eexamples/foundational/31-heartbeats.py\u003c/code\u003e shows how to enable heartbeats and\nforces warnings to be displayed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eLLMTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eTTSTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e which should be pushed by LLM and TTS\nservices respectively instead of \u003ccode\u003eTextFrame\u003c/code\u003es.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eOpenRouter\u003c/code\u003e for OpenRouter integration with an OpenAI-compatible\ninterface. Added foundational example \u003ccode\u003e14m-function-calling-openrouter.py\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded a new \u003ccode\u003eWebsocketService\u003c/code\u003e based class for TTS services, containing\nbase functions and retry logic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDeepSeekLLMService\u003c/code\u003e for DeepSeek integration with an OpenAI-compatible\ninterface. For example, transfer a SIP call to a different\nSIP address or transfer a PSTN phone number to a different PSTN phone number.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport.sip_refer()\u003c/code\u003e to transfer incoming SIP/PSTN calls from\noutside Daily to another SIP/PSTN address.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded an \u003ccode\u003eauto_mode\u003c/code\u003e input parameter to \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e. \u003ccode\u003eauto_mode\u003c/code\u003e\nis set to \u003ccode\u003eTrue\u003c/code\u003e by default. Enabling this setting disables the chunk\nschedule and all buffers, which reduces latency.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eKoalaFilter\u003c/code\u003e which implement on device noise reduction using Koala\nNoise Suppression.\n(see \u003ca href=\"https://picovoice.ai/platform/koala/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://picovoice.ai/platform/koala/\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eCerebrasLLMService\u003c/code\u003e for Cerebras integration with an OpenAI-compatible\ninterface. Added foundational example \u003ccode\u003e14k-function-calling-cerebras.py\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003ePipecat now supports Python 3.13. We had a dependency on the \u003ccode\u003eaudioop\u003c/code\u003e package\nwhich was deprecated and now removed on Python 3.13. We are now using\n\u003ccode\u003eaudioop-lts\u003c/code\u003e (\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/AbstractUmbra/audioop\"\u003ehttps://github.com/AbstractUmbra/audioop\u003c/a\u003e) to provide the same\nfunctionality.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded timestamped conversation transcript support:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew \u003ccode\u003eTranscriptProcessor\u003c/code\u003e factory provides access to user and assistant\ntranscript processors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eUserTranscriptProcessor\u003c/code\u003e processes user speech with timestamps from\ntranscription.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eAssistantTranscriptProcessor\u003c/code\u003e processes assistant responses with LLM\ncontext timestamps.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMessages emitted with ISO 8601 timestamps indicating when they were spoken.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupports all LLM formats (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google) via standard message\nformat.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew examples: \u003ccode\u003e28a-transcription-processor-openai.py\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003e28b-transcription-processor-anthropic.py\u003c/code\u003e, and\n\u003ccode\u003e28c-transcription-processor-gemini.py\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdd support for more languages Tokens were summed incorrectly\n(double-counted in many cases).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue that could cause the bot to stop talking if there was a user\ninterruption before getting any audio from the TTS service.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue that would cause \u003ccode\u003eParallelPipeline\u003c/code\u003e to handle \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e\nincorrectly causing the main pipeline to not terminate or terminate too early.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an audio stuttering issue in \u003ccode\u003eFastPitchTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eBaseOutputTransport\u003c/code\u003e issue that was causing non-audio frames being\nprocessed before the previous audio frames were played. This will allow, for\nexample, sending a frame \u003ccode\u003eA\u003c/code\u003e after a \u003ccode\u003eTTSSpeakFrame\u003c/code\u003e and the frame \u003ccode\u003eA\u003c/code\u003e will\nonly be \u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e. This is an integration for Google's\nGemini Multimodal Live API, supporting:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReal-time audio and video input processing\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eStreaming text responses with TTS\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAudio transcription for both user and bot speech\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFunction calling\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSystem instructions and context management\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDynamic parameter updates (temperature, top_p, etc.)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eAudioTranscriber\u003c/code\u003e utility class for handling audio transcription with\nGemini models.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new context classes for Gemini:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveContext\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveUserContextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveAssistantContextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveContextAggregatorPair\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new foundational examples for \u003ccode\u003eGeminiMultimodalLiveLLMService\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003e26-gemini-multimodal-live.py\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003e26a-gemini-live-transcription.py\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003e26b-gemini-live-video.py\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003e26c-gemini-live-video.py\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eSimliVideoService\u003c/code\u003e. This is an integration for Simli AI avatars.\n(see \u003ca href=\"https://www.simli.com\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.simli.com\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded NVIDIA Riva's \u003ccode\u003eFastPitchTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eParakeetSTTService\u003c/code\u003e.\n(see \u003ca href=\"https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/ai-data-science/products/riva/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.nvidia.com/en-us/ai-data-science/products/riva/\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eIdentityFilter\u003c/code\u003e. This is the simplest frame filter that lets through\nall incoming frames.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNew \u003ccode\u003eSTTMuteStrategy\u003c/code\u003e called \u003ccode\u003eFUNCTION_CALL\u003c/code\u003e which mutes the STT service\nduring LLM function calls.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDeepgramSTTService\u003c/code\u003e now exposes two event handlers \u003ccode\u003eon_speech_started\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eon_utterance_end\u003c/code\u003e that could be used to implement interruptions. See new\nexample \u003ccode\u003eexamples/foundational/07c-interruptible-deepgram-vad.py\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eGroqLLMService\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eGrokLLMService\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003eNimLLMService\u003c/code\u003e for Groq, Grok,\nand NVIDIA NIM API integration, with an OpenAI-compatible interface.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNew examples demonstrating function calling with Groq, Grok, Azure OpenAI,\nFireworks, and NVIDIA NIM: \u003ccode\u003e14f-function-calling-groq.py\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003e14g-function-calling-grok.py\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e14h-function-calling-azure.py\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003e14i-function-calling-fireworks.py\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003e14j-function-calling-nvidia.py\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIn order to obtain the audio stored by the \u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e you can now\nalso register an \u003ccode\u003eon_audio_data\u003c/code\u003e event handler. The \u003ccode\u003eon_audio_data\u003c/code\u003e handler\nwill be called every time \u003ccode\u003ebuffer_size\u003c/code\u003e (a new constructor argument) is\nreached. If \u003ccode\u003ebuffer_size\u003c/code\u003e is 0 (default) you need to manually get the audio as\nbefore using \u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor.merge_audio_buffers()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative supports multiple simultaneous muting strategies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eXTTSService\u003c/code\u003e language now defaults to anymore to avoid startup\ndelays. The sample rate of the provided sound files now need to match the\nsample rate of the output transport.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eInput frames (audio, image and transport messages) are now system frames. This\nmeans they are processed immediately by all processors instead of being queued\ninternally.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eExpanded the transcriptions.language module to support a superset of\nlanguages.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated STT and TTS services with language options that match the supported\nlanguages for each service.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated the \u003ccode\u003eAzureLLMService\u003c/code\u003e to use the \u003ccode\u003eOpenAILLMService\u003c/code\u003e. Updated the\n\u003ccode\u003eapi_version\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003e2024-09-01-preview\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated the \u003ccode\u003eFireworksLLMService\u003c/code\u003e to use the \u003ccode\u003eOpenAILLMService\u003c/code\u003e. Updated the\ndefault model to \u003ccode\u003eaccounts/fireworks/models/firefunction-v2\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated the \u003ccode\u003esimple-chatbot\u003c/code\u003e example to include a Javascript and React client\nexample, using RTVI JS and React.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eRemoved\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-removed-13\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Removed\" href=\"#removed-13\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoved \u003ccode\u003eAppFrame\u003c/code\u003e. This was used as a special user custom frame, but there's\nactually no use case for that.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-fixed-46\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Fixed\" href=\"#fixed-46\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eParallelPipeline\u003c/code\u003e issue that would cause system frames to be queued.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed \u003ccode\u003eFastAPIWebsocketTransport\u003c/code\u003e so it can work with binary data (e.g. using\nthe protobuf serializer).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eCartesiaTTSService\u003c/code\u003e that could cause previous audio to be\nreceived after an interruption.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed Cartesia, ElevenLabs, LMNT and PlayHT TTS websocket\nreconnection. Before, if an error occurred no reconnection was happening.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eBaseOutputTransport\u003c/code\u003e issue that was causing audio to be discarded\nafter an \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e was received.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eWebsocketServerTransport\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eFastAPIWebsocketTransport\u003c/code\u003e\nthat would cause a busy loop when using audio mixer.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eLiveKitTransport\u003c/code\u003e issue where connections were\nbeing closed in the input transport prematurely. This was causing frames\nqueued inside the pipeline being discarded.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e that would cause some internal callbacks to\nnot be executed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue where other frames were being processed while a \u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e\nwas being pushed down the pipeline.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eAudioBufferProcessor\u003c/code\u003e now handles interruptions properly.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eWebsocketServerTransport\u003c/code\u003e issue that would prevent interruptions with\n\u003ccode\u003eTwilioSerializer\u003c/code\u003e from working.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport.capture_participant_video\u003c/code\u003e now allows capturing user's screen\nshare by simply passing \u003ccode\u003evideo_source=\"screenVideo\"\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed Google Gemini message handling to properly convert appended messages to\nGemini's required format.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue with \u003ccode\u003eFireworksLLMService\u003c/code\u003e where chat completions were failing\nby removing the \u003ccode\u003estream_options\u003c/code\u003e from the chat completion options.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e[0.0.49] - \u003ccode\u003eon_bot_started\u003c/code\u003e event which is useful in a single turn\ninteraction.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e events \u003ccode\u003edialin-connected\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003edialin-stopped\u003c/code\u003e,\n\u003ccode\u003edialin-error\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003edialin-warning\u003c/code\u003e. Needs daily-python \u0026gt;= 0.13.0.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eRimeHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and the \u003ccode\u003e07q-interruptible-rime.py\u003c/code\u003e foundational\nexample.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eSTTMuteFilter\u003c/code\u003e, a general-purpose processor that combines STT\nmuting and interruption control. When active, it prevents both transcription\nand interruptions during bot speech. The processor supports multiple\nstrategies: \u003ccode\u003eFIRST_SPEECH\u003c/code\u003e (mute only during bot's first\nspeech), \u003ccode\u003eALWAYS\u003c/code\u003e (mute during all bot speech), or \u003ccode\u003eCUSTOM\u003c/code\u003e (using provided\ncallback).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eSTTMuteFrame\u003c/code\u003e, a control frame that enables/disables speech\ntranscription in STT services.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 queue in each frame processor. When you call\n\u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.push_frame()\u003c/code\u003e this will internally call\n\u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.queue_frame()\u003c/code\u003e on the next processor (upstream or downstream)\nand the frame will be internally queued (except system frames). Then, the\nqueued frames will get processed. With this input queue it is also possible\nfor FrameProcessors to block processing more frames by calling\n\u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.pause_processing_frames()\u003c/code\u003e. The way to resume processing\nframes is by calling \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.resume_processing_frames()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded audio filter \u003ccode\u003eNoisereduceFilter\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduce input transport audio filters (\u003ccode\u003eBaseAudioFilter\u003c/code\u003e). Audio filters can\nbe used to remove background noises before audio is sent to VAD.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIntroduce output transport audio mixers (\u003ccode\u003eBaseAudioMixer\u003c/code\u003e). Output transport\naudio mixers can be used, for example, to add background sounds or any other\naudio mixing functionality before the output audio is actually written to the\ntransport.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eGatedOpenAILLMContextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e. This aggregator keeps the last\nreceived OpenAI LLM context frame and it doesn't let it through until the\nnotifier is notified.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eWakeNotifierFilter\u003c/code\u003e. This processor expects a list of frame types and\nwill execute a given callback predicate when a frame of any of those type is\nbeing processed. If the callback returns true the notifier will be notified.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eNullFilter\u003c/code\u003e. A null filter doesn't push any frames upstream or\ndownstream. This is usually used to disable one of the pipelines in\n\u003ccode\u003eParallelPipeline\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eEventNotifier\u003c/code\u003e. This can be used as a very simple synchronization\nfeature between processors.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eTavusVideoService\u003c/code\u003e. This is an integration for Tavus digital twins.\n(see \u003ca href=\"https://www.tavus.io/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.tavus.io/\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport.update_subscriptions()\u003c/code\u003e. and\n\u003ccode\u003eRTVIBotTTSProcessor\u003c/code\u003e/\u003ccode\u003eRTVIBotTTSTextProcessor\u003c/code\u003e to avoid out of order issues.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in RTVI protocol that could cause a \u003ccode\u003ebot-llm-stopped\u003c/code\u003e or\n\u003ccode\u003ebot-tts-stopped\u003c/code\u003e message to be sent before a \u003ccode\u003ebot-llm-text\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003ebot-tts-text\u003c/code\u003e\nmessage.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed \u003ccode\u003eDeepgramSTTService\u003c/code\u003e constructor settings not being merged with default\nones.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in Daily transport that would cause tasks to be hanging if\nurgent transport messages were being sent from a transport event handler.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eBaseOutputTransport\u003c/code\u003e that would cause \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e to be\npushed downed too early and call \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor.cleanup()\u003c/code\u003e before letting the\ntransport stop properly.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" been added to report frame processor metrics to\nSentry. This is now possible because \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessorMetrics\u003c/code\u003e can now be passed\nto \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded Google TTS service and corresponding foundational example\n\u003ccode\u003e07n-interruptible-google.py\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded AWS Polly TTS support and \u003ccode\u003e07m-interruptible-aws.py\u003c/code\u003e as an example.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded InputParams to Azure TTS service.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eLivekitTransport\u003c/code\u003e (audio-only for now).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRTVI 0.2.0 is now supported.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAll \u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessors\u003c/code\u003e can now register event handlers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"tts = SomeTTSService(...)\n\n@tts.event_handler(\u0026quot;on_connected\u0026quot;):\nasync def on_connected(processor):\n  ...\"\u003e\u003cpre class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003etts = SomeTTSService(...)\n\n@tts.event_handler(\"on_connected\"):\nasync def on_connected(processor):\n  ...\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eAsyncGeneratorProcessor\u003c/code\u003e. This processor can be used together with a\n\u003ccode\u003eFrameSerializer\u003c/code\u003e as an async generator. It provides a \u003ccode\u003egenerator()\u003c/code\u003e function\nthat returns an \u003ccode\u003eAsyncGenerator\u003c/code\u003e and that yields serialized frames.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eEndTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eCancelTaskFrame\u003c/code\u003e. These are new frames that are\nmeant to be pushed upstream to tell the pipeline task to stop nicely or\nimmediately respectively.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded configurable LLM parameters (e.g., temperature, top_p, max_tokens, seed)\nfor OpenAI, Anthropic, and Together AI services along with corresponding\nsetter functions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003esample_rate\u003c/code\u003e as a constructor parameter for TTS services.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003ePipecat has a pipeline-based architecture. The pipeline consists of frame\nprocessors linked to each other. The elements traveling across the pipeline\nare called frames.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo have a deterministic behavior the frames traveling through the pipeline\nshould always be ordered, except system frames which are out-of-band\nframes. To achieve that, each frame processor should only output frames from a\nsingle task.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIn this version all the frame processors have their own task to push\nframes. That is, when \u003ccode\u003epush_frame()\u003c/code\u003e is called the given frame will be put\ninto an internal queue (with the exception of system frames) and a frame\nprocessor task will push it out.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded pipeline clocks. A pipeline clock is used by the output transport to\nknow when a frame needs to be presented. For that, all frames now have an\noptional \u003ccode\u003epts\u003c/code\u003e field (prensentation timestamp). There's currently just one\nclock implementation \u003ccode\u003eSystemClock\u003c/code\u003e and the \u003ccode\u003epts\u003c/code\u003e field is currently only used\nfor \u003ccode\u003eTextFrame\u003c/code\u003es (audio and image frames will be next).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eA clock can now be specified to \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e (defaults to\n\u003ccode\u003eSystemClock\u003c/code\u003e). This clock will be passed to each frame processor via the\n\u003ccode\u003eStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eCartesiaHttpTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e now supports setting the audio bitrate to improve audio\nquality through the \u003ccode\u003eDailyParams.audio_out_bitrate\u003c/code\u003e parameter. The new\ndefault is 96kbps.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e now uses the number of audio output channels (1 or 2) to set\nmono or stereo audio when needed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eInterruptions support has been added to \u003ccode\u003eTwilioFrameSerializer\u003c/code\u003e when using\n\u003ccode\u003eFastAPIWebsocketTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eLmntTTSService\u003c/code\u003e text-to-speech service.\n(see \u003ca href=\"https://www.lmnt.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.lmnt.com/\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eTTSModelUpdateFrame\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eTTSLanguageUpdateFrame\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eSTTModelUpdateFrame\u003c/code\u003e,\nand \u003ccode\u003eSTTLanguageUpdateFrame\u003c/code\u003e frames to allow you to switch models, language\nand voices in TTS and STT services.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003etranscriptions.Language\u003c/code\u003e enum.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\"
