dir=\"auto\"\u003eContext frames are now pushed downstream from assistant context aggregators.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRemoved Silero VAD torch dependency.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated individual update settings frame classes into a single\n\u003ccode\u003eServiceUpdateSettingsFrame\u003c/code\u003e class.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWe now distinguish between input and output audio and image frames. We\nintroduce \u003ccode\u003eInputAudioRawFrame\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eOutputAudioRawFrame\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eInputImageRawFrame\u003c/code\u003e\nand \u003ccode\u003eOutputImageRawFrame\u003c/code\u003e (and other subclasses of those). The input frames\nusually come from an input transport and are meant to be processed inside the\npipeline to generate new frames. However, the input frames will not be sent\nthrough an output transport. The output frames can also be processed by any\nframe processor in the pipeline and they are allowed to be sent by the output\ntransport.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eParallelTask\u003c/code\u003e has been renamed to \u003ccode\u003eSyncParallelPipeline\u003c/code\u003e. A\n\u003ccode\u003eSyncParallelPipeline\u003c/code\u003e is a frame processor that contains a list of different\npipelines to be executed concurrently. The difference between a\n\u003ccode\u003eSyncParallelPipeline\u003c/code\u003e and a \u003ccode\u003eParallelPipeline\u003c/code\u003e is that, given an input frame,\nthe \u003ccode\u003eSyncParallelPipeline\u003c/code\u003e will wait for all the internal pipelines to\ncomplete. This is achieved by making sure the last processor in each of the\npipelines is synchronous (e.g. an HTTP-based service that waits for the\nresponse).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e is back a system frame to make sure it's processed immediately by\nall processors. \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e stays a control frame since it needs to be ordered\nallowing the frames in the pipeline to be processed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUpdated \u003ccode\u003eMoondreamService\u003c/code\u003e revision to \u003ccode\u003e2024-08-26\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eCartesiaTTSService\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e now add presentation\ntimestamps to their text output. This allows the output transport to push the\ntext frames downstream at almost the same time the words are spoken. We say\n\"almost\" because currently the audio frames don't have presentation timestamp\nbut they should be played at roughly the same time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport.on_joined\u003c/code\u003e event now returns the full session data instead of\njust the participant.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eCartesiaTTSService\u003c/code\u003e is now a subclass of \u003ccode\u003eTTSService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDeepgramSTTService\u003c/code\u003e is now a subclass of \u003ccode\u003eSTTService\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eWhisperSTTService\u003c/code\u003e is now a subclass of \u003ccode\u003eSegmentedSTTService\u003c/code\u003e. A\n\u003ccode\u003eSegmentedSTTService\u003c/code\u003e is a \u003ccode\u003eSTTService\u003c/code\u003e where the provided audio is given in a\nbig chunk (i.e. from when the user starts speaking until the user stops\nspeaking) instead of a continous stream.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eErrorFrame\u003c/code\u003e has now a \u003ccode\u003efatal\u003c/code\u003e field to indicate the bot should exit if a\nfatal error is pushed upstream (false by default). A new \u003ccode\u003eFatalErrorFrame\u003c/code\u003e\nthat sets this flag to true has been added.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eAnthropicLLMService\u003c/code\u003e now supports function calling and initial support for\nprompt caching.\n(see \u003ca href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/prompt-caching\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://www.anthropic.com/news/prompt-caching\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e can now specify ElevenLabs input parameters such as\n\u003ccode\u003eoutput_format\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTwilioFrameSerializer\u003c/code\u003e can now specify Twilio's and Pipecat's desired sample\nrates to use.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eon_participant_updated\u003c/code\u003e event to \u003ccode\u003eDailyTransport\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eDailyRESTHelper.delete_room_by_name()\u003c/code\u003e and\n\u003ccode\u003eDailyRESTHelper.delete_room_by_url()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded LLM and TTS usage metrics. Those are enabled when\n\u003ccode\u003ePipelineParams.enable_usage_metrics\u003c/code\u003e is True.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eAudioRawFrame\u003c/code\u003es are now pushed downstream from the base output\ntransport. This allows capturing the exact words the bot says by adding an STT\nservice at the end of the pipeline.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eGStreamerPipelineSource\u003c/code\u003e. This processor can generate image or\naudio frames from a GStreamer pipeline (e.g. reading an MP4 file, and RTP\nstream or anything supported by GStreamer).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eTransportParams.audio_out_is_live\u003c/code\u003e. This flag is False by default and\nit is useful to indicate we should not synchronize audio with sporadic images.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new \u003ccode\u003eBotStartedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eBotStoppedSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e control\nframes. These frames are pushed upstream and they should wrap\n\u003ccode\u003eBotSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTransports now allow you to register event handlers without decorators.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eChanged\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-changed-51\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Changed\" href=\"#changed-51\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSupport RTVI message protocol 0.1. This includes new messages, support for\nmessages responses, support for actions, configuration, webhooks and a bunch\nof new cool stuff.\n(see \u003ca href=\"https://docs.rtvi.ai/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://docs.rtvi.ai/\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eSileroVAD\u003c/code\u003e dependency is now imported via pip's \u003ccode\u003esilero-vad\u003c/code\u003e package.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eElevenLabsTTSService\u003c/code\u003e now uses \u003ccode\u003eeleven_turbo_v2_5\u003c/code\u003e model by default.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eBotSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e is now a control frame.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e is now a control frame similar to \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eDeepgramTTSService\u003c/code\u003e now is more customizable. You can adjust the encoding and\nsample rate.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-fixed-54\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Fixed\" href=\"#fixed-54\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTTSStartFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eTTSStopFrame\u003c/code\u003e are now sent when TTS really starts and\nstops. This allows for knowing when the bot starts and stops speaking even\nwith asynchronous services (like Cartesia).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed \u003ccode\u003eAzureSTTService\u003c/code\u003e transcription frame timestamps.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue with \u003ccode\u003eDailyRESTHelper.create_room()\u003c/code\u003e expirations which would\ncause this function to stop working after the initial expiration elapsed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eImproved \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e handling. \u003ccode\u003eEndFrame\u003c/code\u003e should end things\ngracefully while a \u003ccode\u003eCancelFrame\u003c/code\u003e should cancel all running tasks as soon as\npossible.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue in \u003ccode\u003eAIService\u003c/code\u003e that would cause a yielded \u003ccode\u003eNone\u003c/code\u003e value to be\nprocessed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRTVI's \u003ccode\u003ebot-ready\u003c/code\u003e message is now sent when the RTVI pipeline is ready and\na first participant joins.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eBaseInputTransport\u003c/code\u003e issue that was causing incoming system frames to\nbe queued instead of being pushed immediately.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed a \u003ccode\u003eBaseInputTransport\u003c/code\u003e issue that was causing start/stop interruptions\nincoming frames to not cancel tasks and be processed properly.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 \u003ccode\u003eBotInterruptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e which allows interrupting the bot while talking.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded These\nwere added in the past to properly handle interruptions for the\n\u003ccode\u003eLLMAssistantContextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e. But the \u003ccode\u003eLLMContextAggregator\u003c/code\u003e is now based\non \u003ccode\u003eLLMResponseAggregator\u003c/code\u003e which handles interruptions properly by just\nprocessing the \u003ccode\u003eStartInterruptionFrame\u003c/code\u003e, so there's no need for these extra\nframes any more.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-fixed-57\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Fixed\" href=\"#fixed-57\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFixed an issue with \u003ccode\u003eStatelessTextTransformer\u003c/code\u003e where it was pushing a string\ninstead of a \u003ccode\u003eTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTTSService\u003c/code\u003e end of sentence detection has been improved. \u003ccode\u003eGladiaSTTService\u003c/code\u003e.\nSee \u003ca href=\"https://docs.gladia.io/chapters/speech-to-text-api/pages/live-speech-recognition\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://docs.gladia.io/chapters/speech-to-text-api/pages/live-speech-recognition\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eXTTSService\u003c/code\u003e. This is a local Text-To-Speech service.\nSee \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/coqui-ai/TTS\"\u003ehttps://github.com/coqui-ai/TTS\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eUserIdleProcessor\u003c/code\u003e. This processor can be used to wait for any\ninteraction with the user. If the user doesn't say anything within a given\ntimeout a provided callback is called.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eIdleFrameProcessor\u003c/code\u003e. This processor can be used to wait for frames\nwithin a given timeout. If no frame is received within the timeout a provided\ncallback is called.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded new frame \u003ccode\u003eBotSpeakingFrame\u003c/code\u003e. This frame will be continuously pushed\nupstream while the bot is talking.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIt is now possible to specify a Silero VAD version when using \u003ccode\u003eSileroVADAnalyzer\u003c/code\u003e\nor \u003ccode\u003eSileroVAD\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAdded \u003ccode\u003eAysncFrameProcessor\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eAsyncAIService\u003c/code\u003e. Some services like\n\u003ccode\u003eDeepgramSTTService\u003c/code\u003e need to process things asynchronously. For example, audio\nis sent to Deepgram but transcriptions are not returned immediately. In these\ncases we still require all frames (except system frames) to be pushed\ndownstream from a single task. That's what \u003ccode\u003eAsyncFrameProcessor\u003c/code\u003e is for. It\ncreates a task and all frames should be pushed from that task. So, whenever a\nnew Deepgram transcription is ready that transcription will also be pushed\nfrom this internal task.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eMetricsFrame\u003c/code\u003e now includes processing metrics if metrics are enabled. The\nprocessing metrics indicate the time a processor needs to generate all its\noutput. Note that not all processors generate these kind of metrics.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" The \u003ccode\u003eMetricsFrame\u003c/code\u003e will report different metrics in the\nsystem. Right now, it can report TTFB (Time To First Byte) values for\ndifferent services, that is the time spent between the arrival of a \u003ccode\u003eFrame\u003c/code\u003e to\nthe processor/service until the first \u003ccode\u003eDataFrame\u003c/code\u003e is pushed downstream. Many of the main ideas such as frames,\nprocessors, services and transports are still there but some things have changed\na bit.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eFrame\u003c/code\u003es describe the basic units for processing. For example, text, image or\naudio frames. Or control frames to indicate a user has started or stopped\nspeaking.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor\u003c/code\u003es process frames (e.g. they convert a \u003ccode\u003eTextFrame\u003c/code\u003e to an\n\u003ccode\u003eImageRawFrame\u003c/code\u003e) and push new frames downstream or upstream to their linked\npeers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eFrameProcessor\u003c/code\u003es can be linked together. The easiest wait is to use the\n\u003ccode\u003ePipeline\u003c/code\u003e which is a container for processors. Linking processors allow\nframes to travel upstream or downstream easily.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eTransport\u003c/code\u003es are a way to send or receive frames. There can be local\ntransports (e.g. local audio or native apps), network transports\n(e.g. websocket) or service transports (e.g. \u003ca href=\"https://daily.co\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://daily.co\u003c/a\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003ePipeline\u003c/code\u003es are just a processor container for other processors.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eA \u003ccode\u003ePipelineTask\u003c/code\u003e know how to run a pipeline.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eA \u003ccode\u003ePipelineRunner\u003c/code\u003e can run one or more tasks and it is also used, for example,\nto capture Ctrl-C from the user.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\"
